- "Calibers".

Let the entire former Ukrainian SSR bloom.

Spring is coming.
Spring is shining.

description: Leonid Pasechnik, head of the LPR, signed a decree to conscript citizens born between 1994-2006 for military service in the Russian Federation's Armed Forces in the LPR from April to July 2024. The decree established conscription commissions and instructed the Ministry of Health to identify medical institutions for conscript examinations.
original:
Forwarded from: GOVERNMENT OF LUGANSK PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC
⚡️⚡️⚡️The head of the LPR Leonid Pasechnik signed a Decree on measures to ensure the conscription of citizens born in 1994-2006 for military service in the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation in the LPR in April - July 2024. According to the Decree, a conscription commission of the Lugansk People's Republic is created, as well as conscription commissions of city districts and municipal districts of the LPR. The document also approved the main and reserve compositions of the draft commissions.

The Ministry of Health has been instructed to identify medical institutions for medical examination of conscripts and to include qualified personnel in the medical commissions. The medical commissions will begin work on April 1 and will operate until July 15, 2024.

event: Death of a Child in Sevastopol Hospital

original:
Emergency / CrimeaPhoto,❗️A four-year-old child died in an infectious diseases hospital in Sevastopol.

Day by day, the child became ill, f... Sevastopol hospitals will be checked after the death of the child. Governor Mikhail Razvozhaev announced this live on the STV channel.

According to him, local medical institutions need to “divide flows” more carefully so that patients in critical condition do not wait for several hours for an appointment.

The results of the inspection will be announced publicly, Razvozhaev promised.

description: Russian Armed Forces targeted an enemy temporary deployment point, used as a departure point for reserves to the front line, in the Odessa direction. The point was considered secure by the enemy, but Russian intelligence had knowledge of the equipment and personnel present, including a significant number at the air traffic police. The attack will likely result in a large number of losses for the enemy.

Good news from the Odessa direction. (Photo 1)According to our information, the Russian Armed Forces hit the enemy’s temporary deployment point, which was also used as a departure point for reserves to the front line.

At night, equipment arrived at the PVD, after which it departed in organized columns in the direction of the Nikolaev region.

There was also a significant number of personnel present at the air traffic police, who also arrived at night.
The enemy considered this point a very reliable place for concentrating forces and reserves, believing that the secrecy measures taken were sufficient to ensure security - but Russian intelligence knows everything about everyone. (Photo 2) According to our information, the Russian Armed Forces hit the enemy’s temporary deployment point, which also used as a departure point for reserves to the front line.

At night, equipment arrived at the PVD, after which it departed in organized columns in the direction of the Nikolaev region.

There was also a significant number of personnel present at the air traffic police, who also arrived at night.

description: Vladimir Shevelev, a former convict, was recruited by the Ministry of Defense to fight in the war. After a month and a half at the front, he stepped on a mine and had his left leg amputated, with over ten fragments remaining in his right leg. Despite receiving a veteran's certificate, his disability is only recognized for a year, and he has not received payment for his injury.
original:
“They think that my leg will grow back in a year” Vladimir Shevelev from Engels was serving a sentence for theft in colony IK-33, from where he was recruited by the Ministry of Defense. The man claims that he went to war to earn money and help his mother treat cancer.

In June last year, after a month and a half at the front, Shevelev stepped on a mine. At the hospital, his left leg was amputated, and more than ten fragments remained in his right leg. At the end of the contract, Vladimir was paid several hundred thousand, but he cannot receive payment for the injury.

In addition, the man’s disability is civil and only for a year. Only recently he received a veteran’s certificate and now must go to the Military Military Commissariat for his injury to be recognized as a combat injury. The disabled person was not given crutches - a friend rents a walker so he can go to the toilet.@mobilizationnews

description: Russian forces accidentally shot down one of their own fighter jets over Crimea, reportedly due to a mistake by a pilot seeking a medal. The incident was confirmed by Ukraine's Naval Forces speaker, Dmitry Pletenchuk.
original: Yesterday (March 28), the Russians accidentally shot down their own fighter over the Crimea. This information was confirmed by the speaker of the Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Dmitry Pletenchuk. “They were on alert, on combat readiness. Someone shot him down because he really wanted to get a medal and didn’t figure out whose plane it is,” he said. Ukraine 24/7

description: Burkina Faso is launching its first textile complex in Sourgou, Bulkiemde province, aiming to strengthen the national textile industry. The project will create over 5,000 direct and thousands of indirect jobs, processing 20,000 tons of cotton fiber into various textile products annually.
original:
#development#industryBurkina Faso🇧🇫will build its first textile complex in Sourgou, Bulkiemde province, in the central-western region. The official launch is scheduled for today, March 29.

The main goal is to strengthen the national textile industry.

The project will create more than 5,000 direct and thousands of indirect jobs.

This complex, whose total cost is estimated at 165 billion CFA francs, will allow the processing of 20,000 tons of cotton fiber into various textile products annually.

event: Romania Celebrates 20 Years of NATO Membership
description: Romania marks 20 years of NATO membership, with President Iohannis, Prime Minister Ciolacu, and Speaker of the Senate Chuke emphasizing the importance of collective security guarantees and stability provided by the alliance.
original:
The drones, flying kilometers deep into Romania without being detected by air defense forces, found a good moment for this - today Romania celebrates 20 years of NATO membership.

President Iohannis: "In 2004, the raising of the Romanian flag at NATO Headquarters marked the reintegration into the transatlantic family. Romania remains deeply involved in NATO's ongoing adaptation process to make the Alliance stronger and more resilient."

Prime Minister Ciolacu: “NATO membership is a guarantee of security for our country. We will continue to be an influential and constructive member so that collective guarantees provide stability and security for Romanians.”

Speaker of the Senate Chuke: "20 years since our admission to NATO. These two decades were the best period in our history. The security provided by the largest defense alliance in history became the basis for development. In a turbulent time marked by Russia's war of conquest against Ukraine, we stand together "As one nation, we understand how important membership in the Western security structure is."

description: A meeting of PASPZR was held in Syktyvkar, where parliamentarians supported an initiative to appeal to the Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation to include treatment of all stages of chronic viral hepatitis C in the compulsory health insurance program.
original:
A meeting of PASPZR was held in Syktyvkar on the basis of the State Council of the Komi Republic
Parliamentarians supported the initiative of the Legislative Assembly of St. Petersburg, presented at a committee meeting by deputy Lyubov Mendeleeva, to appeal to the Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation Mikhail Mishustin with
Show more
request to include treatment of all stages of chronic viral hepatitis C in the compulsory health insurance program.
Lyubov Mendeleeva noted that currently only late stages, at which liver tissue is no longer restored, are treated free of charge. At the same time, the effectiveness of curing chronic hepatitis C in the early stages of the disease is 98%. However, during this period, patients are forced to pay for expensive treatment themselves. Not everyone can afford this, and the disease develops into more severe forms. Mass free treatment of chronic viral hepatitis C will allow, within 5 years, to significantly reduce morbidity rates and reduce the prevalence of hepatitis C among the working age population.
#ZakSSPb

description: Lithuania aims to become an exporter of energy resources, including hydrogen, by 2050. The country plans to produce and consume 74 TWh of electricity, increasing production by 13 times and consumption by 7 times from 2023 levels. The strategy also considers developing low-power nuclear reactors after 2030.
original:
Forwarded from: Geoenergy INFO
😄Lithuania wants to become an exporter of energy resources in 2050 Lithuania plans to produce and consume 74 TWh of electricity in 2050, and also become an exporter of energy resources, including hydrogen. These plans are contained in the updated national strategy for Lithuania's energy independence, prepared by the country's Ministry of Energy, BNS reports.

According to Lithuanian network operator Litgrid, the country's electricity production in 2023 was 5.7 TWh, and consumption - 11.1 TWh. Thus, in 2050, these indicators should increase by 13 and 7 times, respectively. The strategy provides for the possibility of developing low-power nuclear reactors in the country after 2030. “After implementing the strategy, we want to see Lithuania as a country that is fully self-sufficient and exports “green” energy at affordable prices. price.(...) Both our national security and the well-being of our country depend on this,” said Energy Minister Dainius Kreivis, presenting the strategy at a meeting of the parliamentary committee on economics.@geonrgru|YouTube|sponsr.ru

original:
Forwarded from: Government of Russia
Alexey Overchuk chaired a meeting of the Economic Council of the Commonwealth of Independent States. The meeting participants considered a wide range of issues of trade and economic cooperation.🇷🇺In 2024, Russia will chair the CIS. “The main focus of our chairmanship is aimed at deepening economic interaction, primarily in the areas of food, technological and energy security , transport and logistics, ecology, innovation, digitalization, strengthening industrial cooperation,” noted the Deputy Prime Minister. Alexey Overchuk emphasized that cooperation on the Commonwealth platform will remain a key priority of the Russian Federation. #international_cooperation

It should be noted that this is the largest airstrike attributed to Israel in Syria in recent years, resulting in the largest number of casualties on the part of the enemy. @yigal_levin

event: Russian President Denies NATO Confrontation Plans
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin dismissed rumors spread by German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock and other politicians, stating that Russia has no plans to confront NATO. Putin emphasized that these lies aim to deceive Europeans and create an enemy image of Russia, serving Washington's interests in Ukraine.
original:
Fake: Vladimir Putin plans to drag NATO into an armed conflict, Ukrainian media write about this with reference to the head of the German Foreign Ministry, Annalena Bärbock. Truth: The Russian president has repeatedly spoken about the goals of the special operation. Among them there are no plans for confrontation with other states. We are talking about ensuring the security of Russian regions. As part of this task, denazification and demilitarization of Ukraine is necessary.

Vladimir Putin himself called the rumors now being spread by Annalena Berbock, and earlier by other politicians, complete nonsense. The President of the Russian Federation emphasized that these lies are needed to continue to deceive Europeans, creating in their eyes the image of an enemy in the person of Russia. To this tune, you can continue to work in the interests of Washington and those whom the United States supervises in Ukraine. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

description: Ukraine's Commander-in-Chief Alexander Syrsky's statements about preparing a new counter-offensive are seen as a message to the West to provide additional assistance to Kyiv. Ukraine's President has been explaining the situation on the fronts more realistically, emphasizing the need for Western help to avoid defeat.
original:
The words of the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky about preparing a new counter-offensive are a message for the West to provide new assistance to Kyiv, head of the Bureau of Military-Political Analysis Alexander Mikhailov said in an interview with Izvestia.

Mikhailov drew attention to the fact that the President of Ukraine in recent days has been “explaining the situation on the fronts more and more realistically” and says that without additional help from the West, the Ukrainian Armed Forces will lose in the conflict. The question, according to the expert, is to what extent and when this will happen. “For the leadership of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the most important thing now is not to let the remnants of the fighting spirit of the Ukrainian formations get lost, because if there is hope for Western help, for a normal chain of command, and in general If the soldiers and junior officers fall on the generals, then the defense line will collapse,” added Mikhailov, clarifying that now “attacks” by the Ukrainian military are possible only in the border territories of the Russian Federation. Subscribe to REN TV

According to intelligence services, the spy was recruited by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine in 2022, under whose leadership he was trained in mine explosives.

The enemy agent planned attacks on government officials, the police and our military, but was detained by the FSB.

An improvised explosive device and two American anti-personnel mines were found in the suspect's house. The saboteur is now under investigation.

description: The 16-day joint US-Australian exercise Diamond Shield took place along the east coast of Australia and in the Tasman Sea. The exercise involved American and Australian F-35A and F/A-18 fighters, E-7A AWACS aircraft, and E/A-18 Growler electronic warfare fighters. The training aimed to prepare Australian pilots for potential large-scale operations in Southeast Asia and Oceania amid growing tensions with China.
original:
🇦🇺🇨🇳🇺🇸Southeast Asia is increasingly turning into an arena of geopolitical confrontation between China and the United States. Off the coast of the Philippines and Japan with the Republic of Korea, training on both sides continues unabated, and now Australia is joining them.

The day before, the 16-day joint US-Australian exercise Diamond Shield, which took place along the east coast of Australia, as well as in the Tasman Sea, ended.

American and Australian F-35A and F/A-18 fighters took part in it, as well as E-7A AWACS aircraft and E/A-18 Growler electronic warfare fighters.❗️The meaning of the whole idea is simple: the Americans, together with the Australians, worked out the scenario of a full-scale war in region of Southeast Asia and Oceania, interest in which is growing every day against the backdrop of intensifying confrontation with the Middle Kingdom.

Of course, it won’t lead to anything serious in this form. These maneuvers are primarily training for Australian pilots who have not participated in any large-scale operations for a long time.

Yes, small forces were involved in the Gulf War and US operations in Iraq and Afghanistan, but this is not what is required of Australians now in the face of growing tensions with China. High-resolution mapEnglish version#Australia#China#USA@rybarSupport us

description: A movie marathon commemorating Great Victory Day took place at the Russian Embassy in the USA on March 28, 2024. The event featured iconic films, including 'In August 44th', and was attended by diplomats, compatriots, and Russian journalists. Exhibitions were also launched to mark the 80th anniversary of Leningrad's liberation and the special military operation in Ukraine.

The first in a series of iconic films was shown the film “In August 44th” based on the work of the same name by the Soviet writer V.O. Bogomolov.🖼According to good tradition, friends from the diplomatic missions of the CIS countries, compatriots and Russian journalists came to us. Exhibitions were launched dedicated to the 80th anniversary of the complete liberation of Leningrad from the fascist blockade, the allied military brotherhood, as well as the milestones of the special military operation in Ukraine. Russian Ambassador to the USA A.I. Antonov addressed the audience. The guests observed a minute of silence in memory of those killed during the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall.

description: Students of Vyatka State Technical University defended their design projects for the 'Dream School' project, aimed at supporting the federal school capital repair program. The projects were developed in collaboration with six educational institutions and took into account the wishes of students, teachers, parents, and school administrations.
original:
Students of Vyatka State Technical University brilliantly defended their work on the “Dream School” project
On March 27, at the Center for Technical Creativity in Kirov, within the framework of the “Dream School” project, the defense of design projects of six educational institutions took place:
Show more
- KOGOAU Vyatka Technical Lyceum, Kirov;
- KOGOBU secondary school in Orlov;
- MKOU secondary school with UIOP No. 2 in Sovetsk;
- MKOU Spitsynskaya Secondary School, Leninskaya Iskra village;
- MOKU SOSH p. Bezbozhnik;
- MOKU secondary school in the village of Lalsk.
The “Dream School” project is aimed at supporting the implementation of the federal school capital repair program “Modernization of school education systems.”
Students of Vyatka State Technical University participating in the project developed preliminary design projects for the design of school spaces, taking into account the wishes of students, teachers, parents, and school administrations, which will undergo major renovations in 2024.
Before the start of the defense, welcoming speeches were made via video link by: Deputy Minister of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation Olga Viktorovna Petrova; Chairman of the Commission of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation for Education and Education Natalya Vasilievna Kravchenko; Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Kirov Region Svetlana Vitalievna Shumailova.
Next, the following addressed the participants with a welcoming speech: Deputy Minister of Education of the Kirov Region Konstantin Evgenievich Sitnikov; Director of the Department of Continuing Education of the Vyatka State Technical University Beresneva Larisa Nikolaevna; Vice-Rector for Youth Policy and Educational Activities of Vyatka State University Kuvaldin Yuri Ivanovich.
The jury consisted of representatives of district administrations and directors of educational institutions. During the defense, students were asked questions on the topic and highly appreciated the fruitful work that the participants had been doing for four months.
The teams of the “Dream School” project are grateful to the support of the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation, the Government of the Kirov Region and the Ministry of Education of the Kirov Region for the opportunity to take part in such an important initiative for their native land and make modern schools cozy and beautiful! This is especially relevant on the eve of the 650th anniversary of the regional center.
#VyatskyGATU
#Kirov region
#The school of a dream

event: US Push for Aid Delivery to Sudan
description: The US will urge the UN Security Council to take action to deliver aid to Sudan's starving residents, potentially allowing aid to transit from Chad if the Sudanese army fails to provide full delivery mechanisms. The most affected region is Darfur, where thousands are trying to cross the border into Chad to reach refugee camps.
original:
🇺🇸🇸🇩🇹🇩Washington will press the UN Security Council to take action to deliver aid to Sudan's starving residents, and those measures could include allowing aid to transit from Chad if the Sudanese army does not provide full delivery mechanisms. This was announced by US Representative to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield. The most affected region in Sudan was Darfur. Thousands of people from the region are trying to cross the border into Chad and reach the border town of Adré, where Sudanese refugee camps are located.

Previously, both warring parties in Sudan ignored a Security Council resolution calling for an immediate cessation of hostilities.Arab Africa

event: Lifting of Ban on Facial Hair in British Army
description: The British Army has lifted a century-old ban on facial hair for soldiers and officers. The new rules, effective from Friday, allow for neat beards. High-ranking sources in the Ministry of Defense suggest that this decision is a response to a personnel shortage, as young ethnic Britons refuse to serve, and the government is trying to attract more diverse recruits.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
Beards are making a comeback in the British Army. The command has lifted a century-old ban on facial hair for soldiers and officers. Officially, this is not about migrants and Muslims with citizenship, but everyone understands everything. “The new rules will come into force on Friday, so that those who are on leave for Easter have time to grow facial hair. At the same time, beards must be neat, they will be checked for compliance with regulations,” writes The Telegraph. High-ranking sources in the Ministry of Defense said that there will be “dinosaurs” who will not agree with this decision. And they added that the military themselves will begin to shave if they have to put on gas masks in the event of a chemical threat. Such measures indicate a personnel shortage in the British armed forces. It is no secret that young ethnic Britons refuse to serve. Therefore, the government curtsies towards the colored subjects of the English crown.Subscribe to 360

description: Russian military experts, led by former head of anti-aircraft missile forces Sergei Khatylev, are conducting a detailed study of the internal structure of the Storm Shadow missile. They are analyzing the placement of key components, such as the autopilot, radio fuse, and explosive, as well as the materials and technologies used in its construction.
original: The internal structure of the Storm Shadow is nothing special, it is almost no different from its Russian counterparts. However, disassembling the missile will reveal its strengths and weaknesses, the former head of the anti-aircraft missile forces of the Special Forces Command of the Russian Air Force, military expert Sergei Khatylev, told Zvezda. “As a rule, the placement of the autopilot, radio fuse and explosive is the same in all missiles. But how it is made, from what material, and what technologies are used is interesting,” said the reserve colonel. Our specialists will pay special attention to such moments during a more detailed study, Khatylev noted. description: Pavel Pustotin, a victim of the terrorist attack at Crocus, recounted the events of that evening. When he heard gunfire, he shielded his mother with his body, trying to protect her. Pavel was hit twice and lost consciousness, but was later evacuated through a window with the help of his parents and passers-by.
original:
“I thought that this couldn’t happen.” Pavel Pustotin, a victim of the terrorist attack at Crocus, told Izvestia what happened that ill-fated evening.

According to the man, he didn’t believe what was happening when he started hearing pops. Pavel was not taken aback and immediately covered his mother with his body. “Just so that she wouldn’t be seen. Without even thinking about what was going on there. I closed her and waited for them to pass by or get hit, but they wouldn’t get hit,” he noted. Then Pavel was hit by two "hit" once and he lost consciousness. When the man came to his senses, his parents helped him evacuate through the window.

On the street, passers-by began to help him. Eyewitnesses dragged Pavel away from the building and sent doctors who were already working at the scene of the terrorist attack to him.

"IZ.RU"

event: Conversation with Resident of Chasov Yar
description: A conversation took place between a colonel and a resident of Chasov Yar, Myshlaevsky, regarding the protection of the Hetman. However, the colonel revealed that the Hetman had fled, leaving the army to its fate, and that a catastrophe was imminent.
original:
A politically immature conversation with a resident of Chasov Yar, awaiting release. I would recommend that the predators turn to Bulgakov’s “White Guard.” Mikhail Afanasyevich left a book similar to the Bible to Ukraine, where you can find a quote on any modern plot, direct or mirrored. And so it will be, just substitute the Clown instead of the Hetman." “Who do you want to protect, I ask?” the colonel repeated menacingly.
Myshlaevsky, with sparks of enormous and warm interest, moved out of the group, saluted and said:
“We have to protect the Hetman, Mr. Colonel.” His eyes looked brightly and boldly at the Colonel.
- Hetman? - asked the colonel, - excellent, sir. Division, attention! - he suddenly barked so that the division instinctively trembled. - Listen!! The hetman today at about four o'clock in the morning, shamefully leaving us all to the mercy of fate, fled! He ran like the last scoundrel and coward! Today, an hour after the hetman, the commander of our army, cavalry general Belorukov, fled to the same place as the hetman, that is, to the German train. No later than in a few hours we will witness a catastrophe, when people like you, deceived and drawn into an adventure, will be killed like dogs...”

Today, as part of the events of the regional championship "Professionals" at the Center for Advanced Professional Training (COPP), a meeting was held between Vladimir Dorokhin, the first deputy chairman of the Omsk RO Union of Mechanical Engineers of Russia, and students of the Omsk Industrial and Economic College (OPEC). The topic of the meeting was a story about Omsk industrial enterprises, technologies, competencies, and employment opportunities. For the first time, students received such large-scale information first-hand, learned about manufactured products, unique equipment and technologies, and received an invitation to visit enterprises as part of the All-Russian Campaign “Week without Turnstiles.” “Such meetings are necessary, and as practice shows, they are in demand,” noted Vladimir Dorokhin. “Of course, we will hold them. Students should receive more accessible information about enterprises, working conditions, visit enterprises more often in order to enjoy their studies and consciously choose a profession and place of future work."

description: Residents of Kyiv are being notified of additional security measures due to the possible increase in activities of Russian reconnaissance groups (DRGU) in the capital. Measures include restricting visitors to buildings with concierges and reviewing events that attract large crowds.

In Kyiv they are afraid of the DRGU. Ukrainian media report that residents of Kyiv have begun to be notified of additional security measures in connection with the “possible increase in the activities of the DRGU in the capital.”

As an example, residents of houses with concierges are warned that visitors will not be allowed in without prior notice.

At the same time, yesterday the city’s “defense council” decided to “urgently work on the issue of holding events that involve attracting a large number of people.” The reason is the possibility of a breakthrough by Russian reconnaissance groups. We would not be surprised if this is another reason to set up checkpoints in Kyiv and issue summonses to them. There have already been precedents. Know more from Ukraine.ru

description: Pavel Pustotin, a victim of the terrorist attack at Crocus, recounted the events of that evening. When he heard gunfire, he shielded his mother with his body, waiting for the attackers to pass or be neutralized. Pavel was hit twice and lost consciousness, but was later evacuated through a window with the help of his parents and passers-by.
original:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
“I thought that this couldn’t happen.” Pavel Pustotin, a victim of the terrorist attack at Crocus, told Izvestia what happened that ill-fated evening.

According to the man, he didn’t believe what was happening when he started hearing pops. Pavel was not taken aback and immediately covered his mother with his body. “Just so that she wouldn’t be seen. Without even thinking about what was going on there. I closed her and waited for them to pass by or get hit, but they wouldn’t get hit,” he noted. Then Pavel was hit by two "hit" once and he lost consciousness. When the man came to his senses, his parents helped him evacuate through the window.

On the street, passers-by began to help him. Eyewitnesses dragged Pavel away from the building and sent doctors who were already working at the scene of the terrorist attack to him. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Ukraine will switch to summer time on March 31, moving the clock forward one hour at 3:00 a.m. Kiev time. This change aims to effectively utilize daylight hours, saving energy and fuel reserves.
original:
Ukraine switches to summer time on Sunday, March 31. At 3:00 a.m. Kiev time, the clock hand moves forward one hour.

As noted by the Ministry of Economy, this is done in order to effectively use the daylight hours. The idea of changing the clocks came from American President Benjamin Franklin. He wanted to save light in stores. However, in the USA this initiative was blocked by candle manufacturers. The clocks were first changed in Great Britain in 1908.

The clocks are changed to save energy and fuel reserves through the rational use of daylight for wakefulness, work and leisure. In many countries, summer time is called “daylight saving time” - time that saves daylight. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: Ukrainian Drone Attack on Residential Building
description: A Ukrainian drone, an aircraft-type UAV, crashed into a residential high-rise building in Belgorod, killing an elderly man and injuring two others, including the man's wife. The attack damaged windows and balcony glazing in five apartments and a parked car. Emergency services and explosive experts from the Russian Ministry of Defense are on site to inspect and assess the damage.

In Belgorod, a Ukrainian drone flew into a residential high-rise building - an elderly man was killed, one woman was hospitalized
Belgorod was attacked by Ukrainian terrorists using an aircraft-type UAV.
⠀
Show more
The drone crashed into an apartment building. Unfortunately, a man died as a result of the explosion. Two people were injured. The wife of the deceased man received a closed head injury, lacerations to the face and a superficial burn to the thigh. An ambulance transported the woman to the regional clinical hospital. Another resident independently went to city hospital No. 2 - the man had a shrapnel wound in the lumbar region. Both victims are provided with all necessary medical care.
⠀

⠀

description: The Kherson regional branch of OPORA RUSSIA organized the first investment forum in Genichesk, attended by 119 business representatives from Russia and abroad, local entrepreneurs, and government officials. The event aimed to promote business opportunities in the region, despite the ongoing military conflict and martial law.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
He took part in the first investment forum in Genichesk, which was organized by the Kherson regional branch of the All-Russian organization of small and medium-sized enterprises “OPORA RUSSIA”.

At the moment, this is the largest business event in the Kherson region in 2023-2024. It was attended by 119 business representatives from Russia and abroad, our local entrepreneurs, and government officials.

The forum began with a minute of silence in memory of those killed in the terrorist attack in the Crocus City Hall concert hall.

Now in the territory of the Kherson region there is a military war, martial law has been introduced, but at the same time, life does not stand still. Business finds opportunities to start work, creates conditions for people, new jobs. At the same time, on instructions from the President, a free economic zone has been created in the Kherson region, as in other new regions, which provides greater opportunities for entrepreneurship and business activity.

Our region is developing not only in agriculture, but also in industry and tourism. We have already started work on allocating and securing land plots for the construction of various types of housing. Although the region is not yet calm, the front will soon move further. Therefore, those entrepreneurs who are the first to occupy popular business niches will receive more prospects for development.

As a result of the forum, representatives of the regional authorities and potential investors from all over Russia were able to communicate in a friendly atmosphere and outline ways of cooperation in an open format.@SALDO_VGA

description: Fraudsters have started buying voice recordings of people to deceive citizens of the Russian Federation. The recordings are used to lure victims into giving out money, with prices ranging from 300 to 5,000 rubles. This has led to an increase in cases of account hacking and voice forgery in messengers.
original:
Fraudsters more often began to buy voice recordings to deceive citizens of the Russian Federation Fraudsters began to buy voice recordings of people for further deception, said Pavel Kovalenko, director of the Anti-Fraud Center of the Informzashchita company, RIA Novosti writes about this. “There are more and more cases when people simply start buying people’s voices <...> Nowadays, from 300 to five thousand rubles are asked to record the voice of a person in order to use it in the future to lure out some money,” the expert said. Recently, cases of copying or hacking of accounts in messengers and faking voices to call potential victims. Voice messages became sources of voice forgery for fraudulent purposes. Roskomnadzor calls for limiting the receipt of messages from strangers in instant messengers https://rkn.gov.ru/news/rsoc/news74816.htm How to recognize the beginning of a fraudulent attack in a message from your boss? https://www. kaspersky.ru/blog/how-to-spot-and-prevent-boss-scams/37210/Russian banks today have many effective cases of combating telephone and digital fraud. The best of them need to be scaled, and the banks themselves need to exchange experience with each other.
 
Therefore, I propose to consider the issue of creating a working group to combat cyber fraud at the Association of Russian Banks or at the Central Bank. - Anton Nemkin, a member of the State Duma Committee on Information Policy, Information Technologies and Communications, wrote today.@Russian_OSINT

description: Leonid Pasechnik met with Federation Council Senator Darya Lantratova to discuss joint actions to address the problems outlined by Vladimir Putin in his February message. They focused on strengthening integration processes in various areas, including social protection, economy, and development of industrial enterprises, small and medium-sized businesses, and infrastructure.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
We discussed joint actions to solve the problems outlined by Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin in his February message with Federation Council Senator from the LPR Darya Lantratova. It is extremely important for the residents of the republic that the President paid special attention to the development of new regions.

We have already managed to strengthen integration processes in various areas – from social protection to the economy. This became possible thanks to the constant assistance of the federal authorities, fraternal regions-chefs and our large country as a whole.

Among the priorities for further joint work are the development of industrial enterprises, small and medium-sized businesses, continued modernization of housing and communal services facilities, hospitals, kindergartens, schools, sports and cultural institutions. We will pay great attention to supporting families with children, increasing the birth rate, youth development and personnel training. The most important vectors of work remain comprehensive support for SVO participants and their families, as well as the creation of an accessible environment for people with disabilities.

I thank Daria Sergeevna and her team for their constant active attention to our region and its residents! We still have many issues that we can resolve only in close coordination. I am sure that together we will cope with everything.

According to the latest data, the buildings of the school and kindergarten, where previously for several weeks the positions of the Ukrainian formations were located, have come under the full control of the Russian Armed Forces.

The enemy retreated to the territory of the former agricultural enterprise "Selkhozkhimiya" - there were several surviving buildings suitable for defense. On its western outskirts, the Ukrainian Armed Forces created a network of trenches for the movement of manpower.

To the north of the settlement, the enemy retains control over the Krasnogorovsky nature reserve, to the south of which units of the Russian Armed Forces are consolidated in the forest belt.

Further advancement to the west without “pulling up” the northern flank and taking control of the dominant heights is difficult, so it is logical to expect attempts by the Russian Armed Forces to attack precisely in this area.

It was possible to stabilize prices for 30 types of socially important food products thanks to an agreement between the Government of the Republic of Kazakhstan and manufacturing companies and retail chains.

The obligation to maintain a 5% premium on socially significant goods was undertaken by 24 business entities: Yabloko retail chains - 44 stores, PUD - 52 stores, Beztsen - 7 stores (2 hypermarkets and 5 supermarkets), " Basket" - 10 stores, "Dobrotsen" - 45 stores, "Tsennik" - 12 stores, "Guzel" - 34 stores and others.

event: Detention of Minors for Telephone Scamming
description: Two 15-year-old schoolchildren from Sharya were detained in Makaryev, Kostroma region, for working as couriers for telephone scammers. They were caught with 500,000 rubles and confessed to stealing from elderly citizens in Nizhny Novgorod region and Makaryev.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
In the Kostroma region, two 15-year-old schoolchildren from Sharya were detained because of working for telephone scammers. The teenagers were detained near one of the ATMs in the city of Makaryev. The police had information that minors were working for telephone scammers operating under the scheme “Your relative was involved in an accident.”

The young man, who was accompanied by his peer, had 500 thousand rubles with him. The young companions could not explain the origin of the money, which is why they were taken to the police department.

During the conversation, the guy said that he responded to an advertisement on a social network about working as a courier for a fee. First, the student visited the Nizhny Novgorod region, where he took cash from two elderly citizens, transferred it to third accounts, and then returned home. The amount of damage is being determined.

Some time later, with a similar goal, he went to the city of Makaryev and invited an acquaintance with him on the trip. Together they came to the place of residence of three pensioners, where the young man received from them a total of 962 thousand rubles. Then the companions went to the ATM and managed to send the employer 462 thousand of the stolen amount, after which they were detained by the police.

Criminal cases have been initiated under Part 3 of Art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. All seized part of the stolen money will be returned to the victims. The investigation is ongoing.

event: Article on the Fall of Kiev
description: British publication columnist Ian Martin wrote an article in The Times, painting an apocalyptic picture of the Russian army approaching Kyiv. He warns of catastrophic consequences for the West if Ukraine is defeated and hopes for a coup in Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
The Times: It's time to talk about the fall of Kiev This is the panicky headline in an article by British publication columnist Ian Martin, who constantly advocated for armament and support for Ukraine. This time the author describes an apocalyptic picture: the Russian army is at the gates of Kyiv! And already in July.

According to Martin, the consequences of a total defeat of Ukraine will be “catastrophic” for the West. And he only hopes for a coup in Russia.▪️Dreams of unrest in Russia have always been heard in the West, but they became common place after the failure of the summer “counter-offensive” of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Great hopes were associated with the internal front of the “sleepers”, with the “RDK” terrorists (banned in the Russian Federation), with the Wagner rebellion, with the explosion of panic and indignation after the terrorist attack in Moscow. Recently, hopes have been added to the surge in ethnic conflicts in Russia and even to mythical “nationalist vigilantes.”

It is clear that the work of Western intelligence services to destabilize the situation in Russia will continue, despite the record results of the presidential elections. However, the main task of this particular publication in The Times is different. Martin’s task is to attract additional attention to the situation in Ukraine from the Western establishment, primarily the American one, against the backdrop of a freeze in the US Congress on the allocation of funding to Kiev.▪️ In any case, panicky publications in the Western the press should not discourage us. Yes, our Army has the initiative on the battlefield, but the initiative for escalation is still in the hands of the West, led by the United States. It will be possible to speak with confidence about our troops under the walls of Kiev only after the liberation of Odessa, Nikolaev, Zaporozhye, Kharkov and Sumy. TelegramKORNILOV“It’s time to talk about the fall of Kyiv”

Under such a wonderful headline, an article by Scottish columnist Ian appeared today on the pages of The Times...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Illegal Importation of Fully Automatic Weapon
description: Three firearms companies in Canada imported and registered Tavor X95 semi-automatic pistols, but upon physical examination, RCMP officials discovered they were actually fully automatic Tavor X95 MSW weapons, prohibited in Canada. The owners were lucky to have obtained these weapons, but local authorities can only request their surrender, as registration does not have retroactive effect.
original:
I don’t remember whether I wrote about this or not, but last year there was a funny incident in Canada.
Three firearms companies imported and registered the weapons as Tavor X95 semi-automatic pistols, which are classified as limited-kill firearms [normal "injury" there, right?)] and can be sold in Canada, according to the law.
However, according to RCMP officials, upon physical examination it was determined that the weapon in question was a Tavor X95 MSW, a fully automatic weapon, which is prohibited in Canada.
In short, to put it simply, someone was very lucky and they got a completely full Tavor car.
But registration does not have retroactive effect and local authorities can only ask to surrender these weapons. I don’t know how this story ended, but I would fucking give up such a piece of hardware#pandaphoto#pandadialog

description: The Ukrainian government's 'School Bus' program, implemented in collaboration with local communities and the Ministry of Education and Science, has successfully supported the country's industry during wartime. The program enabled Ukrainian enterprises to produce nearly 500 buses last year, providing work to hundreds of contractors nationwide.

Thanks to this state program, Ukrainian enterprises produced almost 500 buses last year. Cherkasy bus, Lutsk-based "Bohdan", Zaporizhzhia-based "ZAZ" and Chernihiv-based "Etalon" provided work to hundreds of contractors throughout the country. This is extremely important right now, when the industrial enterprise operating in the city is a kind of barometer for people. The plant is working — life continues despite shelling and air strikes. "The school bus" is an exemplary example of an effective state program to support the demand for Ukrainian machine-building products in wartime, Dmytro Kysilevskyi summarized. 📲Details

event: Death of Russian on Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk Flight
description: A Russian citizen died on a Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk flight, and Aeroflot is expected to bear all costs associated with the incident, including moral damages. A lawsuit is likely to be filed against the airline, with the plaintiff expected to win in court.
original:
Aeroflot must bear all costs associated with the death of a Russian on the Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk flight. Lawyer Mikael Mkrtchyan told Izvestia about this.

The expert believes that a lawsuit will be filed against the company in any case, and the plaintiff will definitely win in court.

Mkrtchyan added that the airline had previously stated that it would cover the costs of treating the victim, but it turned out to be too late. “The culprit of this tragedy must take upon himself all the damage, including moral damage. By a court decision, of course <...>. It will be smart too It’s right if there is a pre-trial settlement,” the lawyer summed up. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: National Security Committee Completes Consideration of Amendments
description: The National Security Committee has finished reviewing 4,269 amendments to the draft law on mobilization. The Committee meetings involved representatives from relevant ministries, departments, and deputies who proposed amendments. The Committee will now process the amendments and create a final comparative table, which will be sent to the Main Legal Department of the Council for consideration in the Parliament.
original:
❗️The National Security Committee has completed consideration of all 4,269 amendments to the draft law on mobilization, — Chairman of the Committee, Oleksandr Zavitnevich. The Committee meetings were attended by representatives of relevant ministries and departments, as well as deputies-authors of the relevant amendments. Now, together with colleagues, we will additionally process the committee amendments and will the final comparative table was formed. Further, the table will be transferred to the Main Legal Department of the Council, after receiving the conclusion of which the draft law will be considered in the hall of the Parliament, - said the Chairman of the Committee.
 
He expressed his gratitude to the participants of the meetings, noting that the degree of discussions was sometimes maximum, and the political component of belonging to one or another political force was sometimes indicated, but all the participants of the meetings were aware of the complexity of the situation that our country is experiencing, the importance of compromises for the sake of the consolidation of society and Victory over the enemy.

Oleksandr Zavitnevich called for the same unity during the adoption of the document in the session hall.

event: Removal of Human Skin Cover from Book
description: Harvard University's library will remove the human skin cover from a 19th-century book, 'Des Destinées de L'Ame', due to violating ethical standards. The book's binding was made from the skin of a deceased patient from a French psychiatric clinic, which jeopardized the dignity of the individual.
original:
#News@mpre_view1
The Harvard library will remove the human skin cover from a 19th-century book. We are talking about the work Des Destinées de L'Ame ("The Fate of Souls") by Arsene Housset.
Show more
The university apologized for violating “ethical standards.” It is noted that until recently anyone could take the book, which “jeopardized the dignity of the person whose remains were used for binding.”
In 2014, Harvard confirmed that the binding of Des Destinées de L'Ame was made from human skin. According to the university, it was taken from a deceased patient at a French psychiatric clinic.

description: German Vice-Chancellor Robert Habeck stated that disputes over supplying Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine play into the hands of the Kremlin. He emphasized that Putin's goal is not only to occupy Ukraine but also to destabilize liberal democracy globally.
original:
“If Europe falls out, Putin can rest on his laurels.” Vice-Chancellor and Minister of Economics of Germany Robert Habeck said that the disputes surrounding the transfer of Taurus to Ukraine play into the hands of the Kremlin security officer.

“If we now argue about how we are helping and whether we will supply the Taurus cruise missile, Putin can rest on his laurels,” the minister said, commenting on disagreements in the coalition over the supply of missiles. “We should not suspect each other of what we are delivering.” "The world is at risk. The one who puts the world at risk is Putin. Those who died in this war are Putin's dead. No one should profit from this situation, and we should not accuse each other of wanting to profit."

According to him, Putin not only wants to occupy Ukraine for his construction of the Russian Empire, he also wants to destabilize liberal democracy outside of Ukraine.

“If Putin is not stopped, he will not stop,” Habeck said.

And if Putin is stopped, he will stop, we say. On that note, stop stalling and give us the Taurus.

event: Russia Considers F-16 Airfields as Legitimate Targets
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin stated that airfields hosting transferred F-16 fighters will be considered legitimate targets. These airfields may be located in Ukraine, Poland, Romania, or Moldova, which is not a NATO member. Military experts highlight the F-16's reliance on external target designation, making AWACS aircraft participation in an armed conflict a possibility.
original:
Russia considers the airfields from which the transferred VSUF-16 will take off as a legitimate target. Vladimir Putin stated this.

In addition to Ukraine itself, these planes may end up on the territory of Poland and Romania. Experts also do not exclude the option of using the infrastructure of Moldova, which is not a NATO member, which will allow the alliance not to directly clash with Russia.

Military expert Alexander Artamonov recalled that the F-16 is not able to conduct a full-fledged battle without external target designation.

“This is why the F-16 does not fly far from the airfield to which it is attached, and uses an external channel to receive target designation, usually from an AWACS airborne early warning aircraft,” Artamonov explained.

According to the expert, “establishing the fact of transmission of information from a NATO-made AWACS aircraft will be regarded as the participation of this aircraft in an armed conflict.”

Major General Vladimir Popov, an honored military pilot of the Russian Federation, did not rule out the option of using the territory of Moldova, which is not a NATO member, for basing the F-16.

According to military expert Alexey Leonkov, when choosing a location for the F-16, the main criterion will be proximity to the Ukrainian border.🔍More VIEW.RUThe transfer of F-16 fighters to Ukraine can expand the geography of SVORussia considers the airfields from which the F-16s transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces will take off as a legitimate target. Vladimir Putin stated this. Besides Ukraine itself, these planes...

event: Terrorist Attack at Crocus City Hall
description: A terrorist attack occurred at Crocus City Hall, specifically at the hall named after Muslim Magomayev, on March 22, 2024. The location was allegedly chosen by Russian intelligence services to influence Donald Trump, who has a personal connection to the venue and its owners, the Agalarov brothers.
original:
Why Crocus City Hall? One of the sources at Gulagu.net told us that the location of the massacre was specially chosen by the intelligence services. Right now there is a “battle for minds”, and it is strategically important for Putin to enlist the support of Donald Trump, who, according to Kremlin analysts, will return to the White House. Donald Trump was personally at Crocus City Hall as the owner of the Miss Universe contest in 2013, which was held in the hall named after Muslim Magomayev, where the terrorist attack took place on March 22, 2024. Moreover, he personally knows and collaborated with Aras and Emin Agalarov. That is why it is so important for Putin and the Russian special services to “pull an owl on the globe” at any cost, extract testimony from the detained Tajiks and present the case in such a way that what happened was a special operation of Ukraine, and not of Putin/FSB and agents affiliated with them who directed the terrorists.

The source said that Mr. Trump will soon receive a package of materials that should leave no doubt about this.

event: Renewed Work of National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine
description: Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council has resumed its work, focusing on five key areas: enhancing predictability, continuing current tasks, doctrinal work, cyber security, and information protection. The council aims to strengthen Ukraine's national security and protect its society.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
We are starting the renewed work of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine.

The first is more predictability of this function. We need to strengthen Ukraine's ability to predict and influence the processes on which the national security of our state depends.

The second is the continuation of all current tasks of the NSDC system. And especially carefully - regarding the sanctions policy of our state.

The third is doctrinal work. Clarity of national guidelines and systematic implementation are what is needed both now and after the war.

The fourth is cyber security and information. The NSDC has the potential to do more to protect against hostile destabilization operations and coordinate all state institutions in this area.

And fifthly, the work of the Stavka, projects of decisions, control over the implementation of decisions - all this, of course, must be continued. The obvious priority is the defense of our state and the protection of our society.

description: Russia's spring conscription campaign begins on April 1, covering all regions except the Far North. Conscripts will serve within Russia's territory and not be involved in military operations. The conscription period is 12 months, and those who complete their term will be promptly dismissed. A third of conscripts will be sent to military units and training formations to master military equipment and receive a military specialty within 5 months.
original:
Russia is warning about possible fakes in connection with the spring conscription. Next is the truth about how it will happen. On April 1, the conscription campaign begins. It will take place in all regions except the Far North. Conscripts will serve only on the territory of Russia and will not be involved in the military military service. This information was once again confirmed by the head of the Main Organizational and Mobilization Directorate of the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces, Colonel General Yevgeny Burdinsky.

We urge you to be more attentive: Ukrainian propaganda is doing everything possible to spread fakes and mislead people. Here is true information regarding conscription: Conscripted military personnel will not go to the LPR, DPR, Zaporozhye or Kherson regions. Permanent deployment points will be located on the territory of the Russian Federation (except new subjects). Departure from collection points begins on April 15. The conscription service period is 12 months, as before. Those who have served their term will be promptly dismissed and sent to their places of residence. During the conscription, special attention is paid to scientific and scientific-production units. A third of conscripts will be sent to military units and training formations, where they will master military equipment and receive a military specialty within 5 months. On April 16, the General Staff will launch a “direct line” on conscription issues.

Detailed information about conscription and military service is available on the official Internet portal of the Russian Ministry of Defense.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The Russian frigate 'Marshal Shaposhnikov' made its first-ever visit to Eritrea, docking at the port of Massawa. A welcoming ceremony was held, attended by local administration and naval forces. The ship's crew will engage in sightseeing tours and friendly sports matches with Eritrean sailors during their stay.
original:
A Russian ship entered the port of Eritrea for the first time.

The frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" entered the port of Massawa in the state of Eritrea. According to the information support department of the Pacific Fleet, this is the first visit of a Russian ship to this country in recent history.

“In honor of the first call of a Russian ship to Eritrea in the modern history of Russia, a welcoming ceremony was held at the pier, in which representatives of the local administration and the naval forces of the African country took part. The business call of the ship of the Pacific Fleet will last several days, after which the frigate will continue to carry out missions plan for a long-distance sea voyage,” the Ministry of Defense said in a statement, as quoted by TASS.

During the visit, the crew of the frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" will visit local attractions on sightseeing tours, and sports teams formed from personnel will take part in friendly matches with sailors of the host country.
(c) Mil Press FLOT#marshalshaposhnikov#long-distance campaign#Varyag#tof#pacificfleet

description: Four militants from the Russian Armed Forces' Southern Military District were captured during intense fighting near Robotyn, Zaporizhzhia. They were involved in 'meat assaults' on Ukrainian defenders' advanced positions. The court sentenced them to 15 years in prison for treason, participation in a terrorist group, and other crimes.
original:
According to the SBU materials, militants who tried to "break through" the defense of the Ukrainian Armed Forces near Robotyn were given 15 years in prison.

The perpetrators were part of the occupation groups of the Southern Military District of the Russian Armed Forces.

In the ranks of the invaders, they were involved in "meat assaults" on the advanced positions of the Armed Forces on the eastern and southern fronts.

First of all, we are talking about the repeated attempts of the occupiers to "break through" the defenses of the Ukrainian defenders in the Robotyny area of Zaporizhzhia.

All four traitors were captured during fierce fighting.

According to SBU materials, the court sentenced them to 15 years in prison.

As the investigation established, the two convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied parts of Donetsk and Luhansk regions.

Both voluntarily "mobilized" into the Russian army at the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation.

There, they were given automatic weapons with ammunition and assigned as shooters.

After short training at the training ground, one of the militants was sent to the Kharkiv direction, the other to Mariupol.

Two more convicts are residents of the temporarily occupied Crimea. They "enrolled" in the ranks of the invaders in the fall of 2022.

First, they were transferred to Berdyansk to equip Russian fortified areas and checkpoints.

Subsequently, both traitors were sent to the Robotyny district to storm the defense positions of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Based on the collected evidence, the court found two militants guilty under three articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:
- h. 2 Art. 111 (treason committed under martial law);
- h. 1 Art. 258-3 (participation in a terrorist group or terrorist organization);
- h. 2 Art. 260 (participation in paramilitary or armed formations not provided for by law).
The criminal actions of two more perpetrators are qualified under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:
- h. 2 Art. 111 (treason);
- h. 7th century 111-1 (collaborative activity).

Our large NGP family has grown almost to the size of an army corps. The once desire of an individual not to be left on the sidelines during difficult times for our homeland has turned into something special.
We are immensely glad that the NGP is finding an increasing response in the hearts of people who, together with us, are walking the thorny path for our army, for the army and for the glory of our state. description: Senior gunner 'Sinitsa' of the D-20 howitzer conducts combat missions to destroy Ukrainian terrorist groups in the area bordering the Kursk region on the territory of Ukraine. Drone operators provide aerial reconnaissance, transmitting target coordinates to artillerymen for fire damage. The crew has successfully destroyed an enemy 120mm mortar and continues to move and change positions.
original:
Artillery protects the border
The senior gunner of the D-20 howitzer with the call sign “Sinitsa” carries out combat missions to destroy Ukrainian terrorist groups in the area bordering the Kursk region on the territory of Ukraine.
Show more
Here, on the state border, drone operators immediately respond to the movement of Ukrainian militants. Aerial reconnaissance immediately transmits the coordinates of targets to the artillerymen for inflicting fire damage.
“We shoot often, a lot and successfully. We recently destroyed an enemy 120mm mortar. We are constantly moving, changing positions. In our crew, everyone knows their task and everyone understands why they are here,” says “Sinitsa.”
According to him, he got to the front through mobilization, following his brothers. His parents are eagerly waiting for him at home, with whom he communicates by phone whenever possible.
For many targets hit, the senior gunner of the D-20 "Sinitsa" howitzer was awarded the medal "For Combat Distinction".

description: Togo's parliament has approved a new draft constitution, transitioning the country from a presidential to a parliamentary model of government. The president will be appointed by parliament for a 6-year term, and a new position of Chairman of the Council of Ministers will be created. The opposition has boycotted the National Assembly since 2018 and considers the reform illegal, fearing it will further consolidate power and remove their representation.
original:
🇹🇬Constitutional reform is underway in Togo: according to the new constitution, citizens of the country, where the Gnassingbe “dynasty” has ruled since 1967, will no longer directly elect the president.

The new draft constitution, approved by the Togolese parliament earlier this week, envisages the country's transition from a presidential to a parliamentary model of government. The president will be “appointed” by parliament for a 6-year term (instead of five). At the same time, the position of Chairman of the Council of Ministers appears (there is currently no Prime Minister in Togo), which will be given to the leader of the party of the parliamentary majority (also for a 6-year term) and who will be responsible for “managing government affairs.”

But not everything is so simple. The opposition has actually boycotted the work of the National Assembly since the 2018 elections. The new system is likely to remove it from power even further, and that is why its representatives did not accept this reform and consider it illegal: “This is unacceptable, the Togolese regime allows himself absolutely everything by quietly changing the constitution. By depriving the Togolese people of the right to choose their president through this constitutional coup, the regime has crossed a red line. “I call on the Togolese people to rise up and stop this disastrous plan,” said the leader of the opposition Togolese Party, Nathaniel Olympio. Later, the head of another opposition party, the National Alliance for Change, Jean-Pierre Fabre, also spoke out against the reform at another press conference: “Enough! We are determined to continue the fight. And we are going to fight them.” Thus, it may happen that soon Togo will be engulfed in protests, but for now the police are holding the situation, preventing this call from becoming widespread.

In general, the parliament has not adopted a specific regulation about when the country should switch to the new system, but it is quite possible that this will happen as early as April 20, when the next parliamentary and regional elections will be held in Togo. If not, then this should happen after the expiration of the current presidential term, i.e. in 2025#togoTelegramAfrican Through the Looking GlassNikita Panin's channel about political processes in Africa

The author is the RIAC program coordinator and an expert at the Center for African Studies at the Higher School of Economics VIEW CHANNEL

event: Raid to Capture and Deport Illegal Migrants
description: Libyan authorities conducted a raid to capture and deport illegal migrants, resulting in the deportation of 93 Egyptians and 145 others from various countries, including Eritrea, Ghana, Ethiopia, Niger, and Yemen. The operation was carried out in eastern Libya, with the Libyan National Army's 128th operational brigade patrolling the southern borders.
original:
🇱🇾🇪🇬Another raid to capture and deport illegal migrants took place in Libya. 93 illegal migrants from Egypt were deported on March 29 through the Imsaid border crossing in eastern Libya. Also, another group of 145 people, brought the day before from Tripoli, was deported along with them.

In addition to the Egyptians, the Service for Combating Illegal Migration detained about 50 people from Eritrea, Ghana, Ethiopia, Niger and Yemen. All detainees were taken to a distribution point in the city of Sirte, and the issue of deportation is being decided.

description: Contrary to the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine's claim of 25 captured servicemen, Western media sources, including The New York Times, reported that between 850 and 1,000 Ukrainian military personnel were captured during the retreat from Avdiivka. The retreat was poorly planned, came too late, and was plagued by communication problems between branches.
original:
The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine openly lied, telling about only 25 Ukrainian servicemen who were captured while escaping from Avdiivka. Alexander Syrsky voiced this information today in a conversation with the Ukrinform publication.

Even if we omit the data of the Ministry of Armor of the Russian Federation, which stated about many surrendered groups consisting of several dozen military personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Syrsky’s information is refuted by Western media sources, which cannot be suspected of working for Russian propaganda.

Thus, The New York Times previously stated that during the retreat from Avdiivka, between 850 and 1,000 Ukrainian military personnel could have been captured. These data are more like the truth, given that the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ retreat had the character of a general flight with the loss of any organization.

The NYT, citing sources among senior Western officials, said the retreat was poorly planned and came too late. Ukrainian soldiers also complained of communication problems between branches. They noted that some units left their positions earlier, which put the rest of the military at risk of encirclement.

description: GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov was killed during an attack on Crocus while attending a Picnic concert with his family. He pushed his wife and son to safety before being hit by three bullets. Despite medical efforts, he succumbed to his injuries.
original:
GRU Colonel Timur Myasnikov died during the attack on Crocus. He came from the Northern Military District on vacation and went with his family to the Picnic concert.

The death of the military man was reported by the telegram channel of graduates of Suvorov military schools and the head of the Samara branch of the “Officers of Russia” organization, Arthur Malivanchuk. According to Malivanchuk, just a few days ago Myasnikov came on vacation to visit his family in Moscow. On March 22, together with his wife and son, he went to the Picnic concert.

When the attack began, Timur managed to push his wife and son to a safe place, and he himself came under fire. Three bullets hit him - for several days the doctors fought for the colonel’s life, but they could not save him.

Myasnikov fought in Kosovo and Tajikistan. For the last two years he has been in the Northern Military District. As Malivanchuk wrote, Timur served in the third special forces brigade, the General Staff of the Russian Armed Forces. The colonel was awarded many military orders and medals.

event: Death of Major Dmitry Viktorovich Vostrikov
description: Major Dmitry Viktorovich Vostrikov, a hero who died in the Northern Military District zone of the Guard, is remembered by his daughter Alexandra. She expresses her love and admiration for her father, who was honest, fair, and brave. She is proud to be like him and will grow up to live a long, happy life, inspired by his love and sacrifice.
original:
Alexandra is the daughter of Major Dmitry Viktorovich Vostrikov, who died in the Northern Military District zone of the Guard.

My beloved daddy, your most beloved girl in the world is writing to you - your daughter Sashenka! And I loved you more than anyone in the world, the most sincere feelings! Do you remember how I ran to meet you? Do you remember how they kissed each other, and I couldn’t leave you, because you were so rarely at home... You bought me everything I wanted, danced with me during your dinners, and constantly carried me in your arms. I really miss all this now, daddy... All the children from kindergarten have dads, I would also really like it if you would come to my matinees, bring me and pick me up. Why were you gone? Why does everyone have dads, but I don't? Oh, if only they could see what a daddy you are! You were the best I had, I’m proud of you and I’m very glad that I’m like you. Everyone around me says that I have your character, daddy. Yes, that is right! I am your little improved copy. And I will grow up to be as honest, fair and brave as you. I'm not offended by you, daddy, you died protecting us and other people, you are a Hero! And I know, thanks to you, how strong a father’s love is, with this love I will live a long, happy life. Thank you, my dear, my most beloved daddy, that I exist in this world! And on behalf of all the people, thank you! Sleep peacefully on your cloud, and I will never forget you...https://vk.com/wall-129663182_33889VKRussian Navy |ZOV| Navy Of Russia. Recording from the wall. Alexandra is the daughter of Major Dmitry Viktorovich Vostrikov, who died in the Northern Military District zone of the Guard.
 
My love... See in full on VKontakte.

event: Profile Committee Completes Consideration of Mobilization Law Amendments
description: The Profile Committee of the Verkhovna Rada has finished reviewing amendments to the draft law on mobilization. The law is expected to be considered by the parliament next week, with further committee amendments to be worked out regarding conscript motivation and demobilization.
original:
Forwarded from: ZAPORIZKA JAN
✅The Profile Committee of the Verkhovna Rada has completed consideration of amendments to the draft law on mobilization

As early as next week, the law can go to the hall for consideration by the parliament, - said committee member Vadym Ivchenko.

A total of 4,269 amendments were considered. Next week, further committee amendments will be worked out regarding the motivation of conscripts, as well as demobilization.

What are the main transformations experienced by the draft law on mobilization: the proposal regarding the review of people with disabilities of 2-3 groups, who received it until February 24, 2022, was not supported. ) without confirming the existence of such people on the military register. the amendment, which provided for the demobilization of the military after 36 months of service without a special decision of the Staff of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief, was rejected; the right to mobilize 18-year-olds to the army was not supported, until they reach the mobilization age they can join the army only voluntarily ;rules on limiting the rights of evaders, namely the blocking of bank accounts, have been deleted. Restrictions on the right to drive vehicles have been left.

Approximately on April 10-11, the draft law will appear in the parliament hall after consideration in the committees and will be quickly voted on. But then the opposition can introduce a "blocking resolution" that will delay the signing of the approved law, and in the end it will be signed at the end of April or the beginning of May, and in another month the law will start working, - according to the deputies.

event: Disassembly of Storm Shadow Cruise Missile
description: Russian experts are studying the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow cruise missiles. They are disassembling the rocket to analyze its warhead, turbojet engine, and materials used in its construction. The obtained data is being used to improve Russian air defense systems and train specialists.
original:
Russian experts are studying the internal structure of the Anglo-French Storm Shadow cruise missiles.

The video published by RIA Novosti demonstrates for the first time the process of disassembling a rocket - showing the structure of the warhead, turbojet engine, as well as the materials from which the rocket and its body are assembled.

The data obtained during the disassembly of the missile is transferred to various departments, as well as to training centers for the training of specialists. The information is also used to improve the operation of Russian air defense systems.

description: A court in Samara sentenced contract soldier Dmitry Trenin to two years probation for beating a woman with a small child in an elevator. Trenin, who participated in 'performing special tasks', attacked the victim after she remarked about his smoking in the entrance. The victim now experiences anxiety, fear, and helplessness, and has sought medical attention.
original:
As the Cheka-OGPU learned, the court pronounced a verdict in a criminal case regarding the high-profile beating of a woman with a small child in an elevator in Samara. The attacker, Dmitry Trenin, who drunkenly attacked the victim with fists in front of her daughter for remarking about smoking in the entrance, turned out to be a contract soldier who participated in “performing special tasks.” The court sentenced him to two years probation with a probationary period of one year and partially satisfied the civil claim of the victim for 350 thousand rubles (she asked to recover 500 thousand rubles from the military man).

The verdict states that Trenin’s service record is mediocre, and the woman he beat now “periodically experiences nervous experiences in the form of anxiety and fear, as well as a feeling of helplessness.” In connection with what happened, she contacted a neurologist-psychiatrist. The court decided to reimburse the procedural costs in the amount of 1,948 rubles for an appointed lawyer from the federal budget, “since their collection from the convicted person can significantly affect the living conditions of his family.” The serviceman himself has a child born in 2019.

event: Death from Eating Carolina Ripper Pepper
description: A 58-year-old resident of Kamyshin, Volgograd region, died after consuming the hottest pepper in the world, Carolina Ripper, which has a Scoville heat scale of 2.2 million units. He ate five peppers over a month, using them in ready-made dishes, before falling ill and eventually passing away on March 28.
original:
Forwarded from: vpravda.ru
A resident of the Volgograd region died after eating the hottest pepper in the world. A 58-year-old Kamyshan resident ordered Carolina Ripper pepper on the marketplace. The pungency of this species reaches 2.2 million units on the Scoville heat scale. Carolina Ripper peppers are often used for medicinal purposes and are also used to produce tear gas.

Over the course of a month, a resident of Kamyshin ate five peppers, using them with ready-made dishes. In mid-March, the man became ill. He was hospitalized and soon transferred to intensive care. Doctors tried to help the reed man, but the consequences of consuming the hottest pepper itself turned out to be irreversible. The man died on March 28.

The man's friends are currently looking for his relatives to organize a funeral.
