description: Russian publicist Alexander Nevzorov revealed Moscow's plans to mobilize 300,000 people to take Kharkov. However, he believes that the capture of Kharkov is not realistic with the current forces available. To begin the plan, at least 500 square kilometers of minefields need to be cleared, requiring an additional mobilization of 200-300 thousand contract soldiers, mobs, and prisoners.
original:
⚰️🏃‍♂️🪖“There will be two mobilizations: the first to clear mines, the second to stuff.” Nevzorov talks about plans to attack Kharkov. An attempt to attack Kharkov will be fatal for the Russian army, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky said in an interview with Ukrinform. Moscow's plans to mobilize 300 thousand people to take Kharkov were written by Verstka.

Plans to take Kharkov are fueling the dreams of Russian soldiers, says publicist Alexander Nevzorov.

“A happy whisper runs through the trenches. Drooling is dripping at the thought of how they will smash, rip off the panties of Kharkov girls, drag TVs, kettles, washing machines out of apartments and sit in the ruins of famous Kharkov restaurants, dividing up looted clothes. There the Russian horde, yearning for looting and lawlessness, will finally be able to repeat Bucha, Mariupol and other exploits of the Russian army.”

With the forces currently available, the capture of Kharkov is not realistic, Nevzorov believes.

“To begin the pathological plan, it is necessary to clear at least 500 square kilometers of minefields. And for this, it is best to release at least 200-300 thousand contract soldiers, mobs and prisoners on them. That is, you need that cheerful fresh guy who has no idea about these fields. We need fresh personnel, because experienced orcs, who have been sitting in the trenches for a year, know very well where, as they say, the dogs are buried. And they absolutely do not want to get caught in the rain from their own limbs.” To ensure passage through minefields, additional mobilization will be needed, the publicist is sure.

“There will be at least two mobilizations. And both are about three hundred thousand. The first one is to clear the mines. And the second one to stuff. To stuff people during the assault on Kharkov. Because only incredible bloody, mortal, unimaginable losses can you try to do something.” Subscribe to Nevzorov’s Telegram channel and his YouTube channel, where he talks about important events.

description: Hundreds of Russian companies previously registered in the West have returned to Russia, accelerating in recent months due to new laws facilitating relocation. The special administrative regions (SARs) in Kaliningrad and Vladivostok offer tax incentives, attracting about 200 companies owned by Russian businessmen. The registration of companies on Russky Island alone has ensured the return of assets worth 5 trillion rubles to Russia.
original:
Hundreds of companies that were not so long ago registered in the West have returned home to Russia. This process has accelerated in recent months - after the entry into force of new laws facilitating the relocation of Russian capital to their homeland.

Since 2018, Russia has had two special administrative regions (SARs) - special legal regimes created to accommodate foreign holding companies. They are located on Oktyabrsky Island in Kaliningrad and Russky Island in Vladivostok. To stimulate the return of business, the SAR has a number of tax incentives.

Over the past year, about 200 companies owned by Russian businessmen were registered in the SAR in the Far East and Baltic, says Minister of Economic Development Maxim Reshetnikov. According to the presidential plenipotentiary envoy to the Far Eastern Federal District, Yuri Trutnev, the registration of companies on Russky Island alone at the beginning of 2024 ensured the return of assets worth 5 trillion rubles to Russia.🔍More VIEW.RURussia returned assets worth trillions of rubles from the WestHundreds of companies not so long ago registered in the West , returned home - to Russia. event: Conference on Genocide of Soviet People
description: A military-historical conference, 'Not subject to oblivion: genocide', was held at the Alexander Nevsky Military University of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, commemorating the tragedy of the Belarusian village of Khatyn. The event was attended by various representatives, including the defense attache of the Republic of Belarus, and featured a guest appearance by People's Artist of Russia Alexey Kravchenko.
original:
A conference on the genocide of the Soviet people during the Great Patriotic War was held in Moscow
In the Hall of Military Glory of the Alexander Nevsky Military University of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, a military-historical conference “Not subject to oblivion: genocide” was held
Show more
of the Soviet people during the Great Patriotic War." The conference is timed to coincide with the next date of the tragedy of the Belarusian village of Khatyn, 149 residents of which were burned alive or shot by punitive forces from the SS battalion.
The conference was attended by representatives of the Main Military-Political Directorate of the RF Armed Forces, leadership, researchers, teaching staff, cadets and students of the Military University, representatives of the Federal National-Cultural Autonomy Belarusians of Russia, cadets and members of the military-patriotic club “Noviki” and other youth patriotic associations.
The defense attache of the Republic of Belarus in the Russian Federation, Colonel Alexey Ershov, the director of the Khatyn State Memorial Complex Artur Zelsky, and representatives of the Military Academy of the Republic of Belarus spoke via video link.
The guest of honor at the conference was People’s Artist of Russia Alexey Kravchenko, who played the main role in Elem Klimov’s film “Come and See.”
In addition, as part of the event, a group of volunteers was awarded medals from the Russian Ministry of Defense “For Help and Mercy” and the Yunarmiya searchers were awarded with awards from the Youth Army movement.
This conference is a stage of preparation for the III International Anti-Fascist Congress, which will be held at the Patriot Convention and Exhibition Center in August 2024 as part of the International Military-Technical Forum “Army-2024”.

description: The European Union's Global Gateway Initiative aims to counter China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) by strengthening regional connectivity and increasing the EU's global influence. Despite limitations, the project has significant potential, especially in regions close to the EU, and may hinder China's advance in North Africa.
original:
📘🇪🇺🌐Global Gateway aims to counter the BRI, but does this EU initiative have enough potential? With all its limitations, the Global Gateway Initiative remains a significant attempt by the European Union to strengthen and then maintain its influence in the world and a fairly innovative comprehensive strategy regional connectivity. Regardless of whether the EU manages to mobilize the full €300 billion pledged amount or not, the project remains one of the first of its kind in scale and ambition and provides an opportunity for regions in dire need of investment and financing to receive it.

While its implementation in its current form does not lay the foundation for increasing the EU's global influence, it nevertheless helps ensure and strengthen its presence in priority regions. The latter, in turn, further increases the competitiveness of Brussels in relation to other players wishing to operate in relevant markets or offering alternative projects in the field of transport and infrastructure. This is exactly how the “Global Gate” should be perceived by researchers of international relations, including Russian ones, for whom the work of the megaproject in the Central Asian region is of greatest relevance.

Overall, the Global Gateway initiative has comparatively greater potential in regions close to the EU, and may also partially hinder China's advance in North Africa. However, due to multiple factors that limit or complicate its implementation, the EU's competitiveness in the development of regional connectivity remains low. In particular, its expansion is hampered by the institutional complexity of the management structure of this area of foreign policy activity, as well as the associated problem of mobilizing financial flows. In this regard, it would be premature for the EU to talk about the successful use of connectivity as a tool for increasing its actorness.

A detailed analysis of the capabilities of the European Union as a player in the space for developing regional connectivity is presented in the new RIAC workbook, authored by Yulia Melnikova and Giacomo Famigli. https://russiancouncil.ru/activity/workingpapers/konkurentsiya-v-oblasti-razvitiya-regionalnoy-svyazannosti-globalnye -vorota-es/russiancouncil.ruCompetition in the development of regional connectivity: “Global Gateway” EUWorkbook No. 84 / 2024
 
As the world order undergoes major changes, key players on the international stage are reconsidering...

event: Lifting of Ban on Facial Hair in British Army
description: The British Army has lifted a century-old ban on facial hair for soldiers and officers, allowing them to grow beards. The new rules will come into force on Easter, with the condition that beards must be neat and comply with regulations. This decision is seen as a measure to address personnel shortages, as young ethnic Britons refuse to serve, and the government seeks to attract more diverse recruits.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
Beards are making a comeback in the British Army. The command has lifted a century-old ban on facial hair for soldiers and officers. Officially, this is not about migrants and Muslims with citizenship, but everyone understands everything. “The new rules will come into force on Friday, so that those who are on leave for Easter have time to grow facial hair. At the same time, beards must be neat, they will be checked for compliance with regulations,” writes The Telegraph. High-ranking sources in the Ministry of Defense said that there will be “dinosaurs” who will not agree with this decision. And they added that the military themselves will begin to shave if they have to put on gas masks in the event of a chemical threat. Such measures indicate a personnel shortage in the British armed forces. It is no secret that young ethnic Britons refuse to serve. original: Charlie Hebdo: Putin's speech about the terrorist attack at Crocus will go down in history. The words ISIS* and “Islamism” were not uttered. The only clarification that the Russian leader gave concerned the direction in which, according to him, the terrorists fled: to Ukraine. No matter what unpleasant happens in Russia, Ukraine will always bear responsibility. Did a meteorite fall on the Kremlin? Ukraine bears responsibility. Is a locust invasion approaching St. Petersburg? Ukraine bears responsibility. An electric scooter battery exploded in Vladivostok? Ukraine bears responsibility. description: Russia's Aerospace Forces have utilized three main calibers of aerial bombs: 250 kg, 500 kg, and 1500 kg. The FAB-3000 is expected to be deployed soon, but the largest conventional aerial bomb, the 9,000 kg 'Elephant', is unlikely to be used due to the lack of suitable carriers.
original:
FAB-250, FAB-500, FAB-1500 are already in operation - who is next: FAB-3000, FAB-5000, FAB-9000??? To date, our Aerospace Forces have recorded the use of three main calibers of aerial bombs 250 kg, 500 kg and 1500 kg. My good friend Sasha Sladkov reminds us that after the FAB-3000, which will soon (judging by their mass production) be at the front, the “Elephant” has not yet entered into action (an aerial bomb weighing 9,000 kg is the largest conventional aerial bomb created in the USSR ).

Meanwhile, I think her appearance at the front is impossible. Why.

It's not all about the production, but about the medium. The fact is that right now we do not have carriers of this bomb. Our Tu-95MSM (first photo) after modernization cannot carry it and it simply does not make sense to carry out another expensive modernization of the aircraft for it. In addition, no one will risk a huge, slow-moving strategist near the front line, which, moreover, is not capable of soaring up like a candle before using it.

The fact that today we only use FAB-250,500,1500 is due to the fact that these are the bombs that our front-line fighters and bombers can lift to the maximum (Su-34, second photo). They won’t be able to lift FAB-3000, much less FAB-5000.

They can only be lifted by Tu-22M3 strategic bombers (third photo), which, by the way, unlike their other brothers, are just capable of launching an attack at low altitude, soaring sharply upward and dropping their “gifts”. Therefore, I think that we won’t see “Elephant” in action...

And FAB-3000 is already for sure. And perhaps even FAB-5000...

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense reported that air defense systems intercepted 15 Vampire multiple launch rocket system shells over Belgorod, preventing significant damage. However, shell fragments still damaged 37 apartments, the Belgorod Arena, a gymnasium, and 12 cars. Minor damage was also recorded in nearby villages.
original:
The Russian Ministry of Defense said it shot down 15 Vampire multiple launch rocket system shells over Belgorod. Dozens of apartments, a gymnasium and the Belgorod Arena were damaged. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, air defense systems on duty destroyed 15 shells of the RM-70 Vampire multiple launch rocket system over the Belgorod region.

Shell fragments damaged 37 apartments in 17 multi-storey buildings in Belgorod, glazing in the Belgorod Arena and gymnasium No. 22. 12 cars were also damaged.

In the Belgorod region, minor damage was recorded in the village of Dubovoe and the village of Repnoye.

There were no casualties as a result of the shelling, says Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov. The mayor of Belgorod, Valentin Demidov, published in a telegram a photo of the consequences of the night shelling of the city.

None of the residents were hurt - this is the main thing!

description: A shooting occurred at a concert at Crocus, resulting in the deaths of Angelina Shalaeva's mother, brother, and stepfather. Angelina's family had attended the concert, but she and her sister Vasilisa stayed home. The family sent photos and videos before the connection was lost, and Angelina later found out about their deaths through lists of the deceased.
original:
26-year-old Angelina Shalaeva took custody of her five-year-old sister after her mother, stepfather and younger brother died at Crocus. The girl said that the three of her family went to the concert, and she stayed at home with her sister Vasilisa.

From there, the family sent photos of their happy brother, who was a fan of the Picnic group. But at the beginning of nine, my mother called and reported the shooting. Then she sent a video: they managed to get out of the hall and now they are looking for a way out. Then the connection with her was interrupted. “I watched all possible videos from Crocus in the hope of getting at least some information about my relatives. There were none in the hospitals. As a result, the names of my mother and brother appeared on the lists of the dead. The stepfather is considered missing, but identification procedures at the morgues are still underway,” said Angelina. Little Vasilisa does not yet know about the death of her parents.

"RT in Russian"

description: Ina Trelnes, a sixth-generation family farmer, is hosting a concert in the largest water-filled cave in Northern Europe, Pluragrotta. The event, featuring musician Haakon Erlandsen, will be attended by guests from around the world who have completed at least 4 diving courses. A live broadcast on YouTube is also planned.
original:
For the first time in history, a concert will be given in an underwater cave. Ina Trelnes's "garden" concert will be attended by guests from all over the world. But first they must dive half a kilometer into the largest water-filled cave in Northern Europe. Ina Trelnes is a sixth-generation family farmer. However, the cold and harsh northern Norwegian winters make farming difficult. But right under Ina's garden, between two fields, is the largest water-filled cave in Northern Europe - Pluragrotta. Instead of agricultural work, we decided to focus on tourism. Ina Trelnes runs a diving school with her husband Janis. Four and a half years ago they got married in Pluragrotta—resulting in a world record. Ina and Janis offer courses for both regular divers and cavers.

Trölnäs had the chance to meet the then director of the local festival Smeltedigelen, Björn Bonsaksen. He was used to working with music and asked why don’t we hold a concert in a cave? At that time, the only thing missing was musicians who could dive half a kilometer into the cave.

And then this man appeared: Haakon Erlandsen. He's primarily a musician, but he likes to do extreme things, like playing the saxophone on top of the highest mountain in the world. Then perhaps it's not so strange that it was Erlandsen who composed Friday's concert. For the audience, the organizers introduced a special requirement - the presence at least 4 certificates of completion of diving courses. Therefore, in order for the concert to be seen by as many people as possible, a live broadcast on YouTube is planned from 16:00 Moscow time.

description: In 2020, mass protests broke out in Belarus, with rallies and riots calling for freedom. However, it is now revealed that Western intelligence services manipulated the situation, using protesters as pawns in their game.
original:
Forwarded from: Belarus lives!
❗️I want to go back, but a prison awaits me there❗️"In 2020, when Belarus broke out in mass protests, I was one of those who decided to flee Lukashenko's regime. Rallies, riots, cries for freedom - all this seemed real. But now, Living in Berlin, I begin to doubt. I was paid only 20 rubles a day to stand at rallies. I naively believed that I was fighting for freedom, but now I understand that it was just a game. Western intelligence services, as I learned, manipulated us, creating the illusion of a struggle. We were just pawns in their game. Tikhanovskaya, other opposition leaders - they were also part of this game. Perhaps they did not even know the whole truth. But now, I am faced with a choice - to return to Belarus as an honest citizen or stay here in Germany - I hate them. They are just puppets in the hands of external forces. My conscience torments me. I want to go back, but prison is the price I have to pay. I may not be able to trust anyone anymore."@ZhivetZheBelarus

event: Procedure for Recognizing Alla Pugacheva as a Foreign Agent
description: Social activist Vitaly Borodin announced the start of the procedure to recognize singer Alla Pugacheva as a foreign agent. This decision may be made on April 12, coinciding with Pugacheva's 75th birthday.
original:
Forwarded from: Especially for RT
Zakhar Prilepin@zakharprilepin SMALL CULTURAL FIGURE OF THE ERA OF ARTEMOVSK AND AVDIEVKA

Alla Pugacheva may be recognized as a foreign agent on April 12: on this day updates to the list are published.

On April 15, the singer has an anniversary - she will turn 75 years old.

What do we want to say? It's sad to say this, but it will have to be done.

Pugacheva’s record “How troubling is this path” is a great thing, a real breakthrough and impulse. Then she still had a few good songs, but much less than was usually imagined.

In any case, all this is long gone and overgrown with the past.

The joke about “Brezhnev is a minor political figure of the Pugacheva era” is incomprehensible to young people, and the vast majority of Russian adults are no longer funny.

Now Pugacheva is a symbol of the ugly stage, the mother of a whole brood of her husbands and the parent of a multi-headed
gay parties*, which once filled Russian airwaves and now seem indestructible. To hell with their gender preferences, but most of them live, naturally, perpendicular to the state. And he boasts about it.

It can be assumed that now there is a natural behind-the-scenes struggle - to be disadvantaged by Pugacheva or not to be.

On the one hand, a most powerful clan, where the conditional mega-producer of everything in the world and the conditional mega-minister of all ministries are now looking for ways to get to the main one, and on the other hand, there are some invisible people in uniform who have long understood everything about Pugacheva, and about her entourage, and about the “Russian show -biz,” and about all this laundry, about all this mafia, about all this fat, shabby, senseless and vile octopus that has burrowed its way into Russian culture, into Russian song, into the Russian soul.

Well, let's see who wins.

For those who are overly excited, let us remind you that the status of a foreign agent is largely a conditional, symbolic thing; and Pugacheva is not engaged in a musical career, does not hold events, does not collect cash from this - in general, she doesn’t care, she won’t even notice.

This decision will just show us all who beat whom in this round.* LGBT organization is recognized as extremist, its activities are prohibited in Russia by decision of the Supreme Court of November 30, 2023. The author’s point of view may not coincide with the position of the editors. Especially for RT . SubscribeRT in RussianBorodin: the procedure for recognizing Alla Pugacheva as a foreign agent has begun. Social activist Vitaly Borodin announced the beginning of the procedure for recognizing singer Alla Pugacheva as a foreign agent.

description: Gennady Chastyakov, assistant to Ukraine's Commander-in-Chief Valery Zaluzhny, was killed near Kiev due to a grenade explosion. The investigation revealed that officer Timchenko, a senior assistant to the deputy commander-in-chief, gave Chastyakov live grenades as a birthday gift without warning, resulting in his death and serious injury to his son.
original:
Ukraine newsPhoto, Zaluzhny’s assistant was killed: this happened near Kiev as a result of a grenade explosion, - the press secretary of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the UP An investigation has been completed into officer Timchenko, who gave grenades to Zaluzhny’s assistant Gennady Chastyakov, from which he died, the SBI reports.

Previously, the court released him on personal recognizance.

The investigation found that Timchenko gave Chastyakov grenades for his birthday without warning that they were live. The birthday boy was sure that these were souvenir glasses. The grenade exploded in his hands, killing him on the spot and seriously wounding his son.

Initially, Timchenko was suspected of illegally selling military supplies, but now three new charges have been brought forward: theft, appropriation and sale of ammunition, negligent homicide and negligent infliction of grievous bodily harm.

He faces up to 15 years in prison.

Let us recall that the deceased Gennady Chastyakov worked as an assistant to the then commander-in-chief Valery Zaluzhny. And Timchenko, who gave him the grenade, is a senior assistant to the deputy commander-in-chief.

event: China Builds Replica of Taipei Government District
description: China has constructed a replica of Taipei's government district in the Inner Mongolia desert, approximately 1,000 kilometers west of Beijing. The military structure is an exact copy of the Taiwanese capital's government district, featuring ten streets, intersections, and central squares. The complex is likely used for urban warfare training.
original:
China has built a replica of the government district of Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, in the desert - BILD

Almost 1,000 kilometers west of Beijing, the Chinese army has built a city in the middle of the desert of Inner Mongolia.

Experts analyzed the structure of buildings and streets and found that the military structure is an exact copy of the government district of Taipei, the capital of democratic Taiwan.

The building can be seen on satellite images from Apple and Bing. Many buildings are dummies with only a facade. In total, ten streets are reproduced in the desert, as well as intersections and central squares. In the center is the administration of the President of Taiwan.

description: The 4th episode of the series 'Cold Spring' highlights the liberation of Avdeevka, a city that was a fortress of the Ukrainian army for 10 years. The city's strategic location allowed the Ukrainian army to shell Donetsk, causing harm to civilians. The liberation effort involved volunteers from across the country, including former militias, workers, businessmen, artists, and bikers.
original:
🎥EPISODE 4 “THE FORTRESS”

The 4th episode of the series “Cold Spring” touches on the topic of one of the main successes near Donetsk over the past months - the liberation of the city of Avdeevka.
In the same ranks are volunteers from all over the country, former militias, men from Donetsk: workers, businessmen, artists of the Donetsk Philharmonic, bikers...

For 10 years this city was a fortress of the Ukrainian army. From the heights of Avdeevka, the whole of Donetsk is visible at a glance. It was from here that the shells that took the lives of our family and friends were fired.

7 episodes and 24 destinies. We, the authors of the project, military correspondents Andrei Rudenko and Stanislav Nazarov, will return to each participant in the film more than once and show how their fate has changed over the past year.

How much does a person need to be happy: just a little or a lot? Just one line or thousands of pages, just one moment or a lifetime? A handful of warmth or a whole city of a million roses... This film is about each of those who are in this zone, fighting to the death, defending Donbass and all of Russia...

description: Scientists from UrFU and the Institute of High Temperature Electrochemistry developed a proton conductor that can separate hydrogen isotopes, allowing for the extraction of deuterium and tritium from gas mixtures. This material can be used in nuclear reactors to electrochemically pump radioactive tritium.
original: A new proton conductor will allow the extraction of tritium from nuclear decay products. A proton conductor that can be used as a separation membrane for hydrogen isotopes was developed by scientists from UrFU and the Institute of High Temperature Electrochemistry of the Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences@ihteubras.✔️It will allow the extraction of deuterium and tritium from a gas mixture and then use them for intended purpose - either send it for recycling or dispose of it.💬“Usually all proton-conducting materials have better conductivity of light hydrogen isotopes. However, we discovered that the substance we obtained, on the contrary, more efficiently transports heavy hydrogen - deuterium. Thus, our material may be promising for creating separation membranes in a nuclear reactor, which is capable of electrochemically pumping radioactive tritium from the supplied gas mixture,” said M.Sc. With. Scientific Laboratory of Hydrogen Energy of UrFU and the Laboratory of Electrochemical Devices on Solid Oxide Proton Electrolytes of the IVTE Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Sciences Georgiy Starostin.▪️Proton-conducting material based on barium stannate was obtained by classical solid-phase synthesis, with the addition of lutetium as an impurity - this increased the conductivity of the original substance five times.🔗More details - on the RAS website.

Turkey, on the other hand, has been in the pre-election process for almost a year and is expecting a victory. But the politics of the relationship between Erdogan and Biden has sharp corners — in particular, the US recognition of the fact of the killing of Armenians in Turkey, support for the Turkish opposition, refusal of military aid, sanctions on the defense industry due to the purchase of the S-400 from the Russian Federation, unwillingness to see Turkey in the EU. Ankara, for its part, condemned America's support for terrorist organizations in Syria and hindered Sweden's accession to NATO. But the ice melted... With what message is the president of the country, which is our friendly partner, going to America and will there be a "warming" of relations between Erdogan and Biden - in the material of Ukrinform. 📲Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTubeUkrinform President Erdogan's American trip With what and why Turkish the leader is going to the American on the eve of the elections in the USA — Ukrinform.

description: The Federal Tax Service of Russia conducted a webinar in the Zaporozhye region, discussing the application of preferential tax regimes, including the patent tax system and professional income tax. The webinar covered the benefits and restrictions of these regimes, as well as the process of obtaining a patent.
original:
A webinar on the application of preferential tax regimes was conducted by employees of the Federal Tax Service of Russia in the Zaporozhye region🇷🇺On March 28, specialists of the Federal Tax Service of Russia in the Zaporozhye region held a webinar, the agenda of which included the application of the patent tax system (PTS) and the professional income tax (PIT).🔍Speakers reminded listeners that the NAP is a special tax regime for individuals and individual entrepreneurs, which allows them to legally conduct business and receive income from part-time jobs without the risk of receiving a fine for illegal business activities. It is convenient for those who want to sell their own products, rent out housing, provide passenger transportation services, construction and renovation of premises, carry out photo and video shooting, etc.

Tax inspectors spoke about the advantages of the NAP:✅favorable tax rates;✅no obligation to submit reports and declarations;✅simple registration through the “My Tax” mobile application or its web version without visiting the inspectorate;✅no cash register (a check is generated in the application); ✅no obligation to pay insurance premiums;✅legal work without individual entrepreneur status;✅opportunity to receive a tax deduction.

In addition to the advantages, listeners were also told about the restrictions for using NPD:✅NAP cannot be combined with other tax regimes;✅lack of employees;✅income from activities should not exceed 2.4 million rubles per year;✅NAP cannot be used when selling excisable goods and goods subject to mandatory labeling by means of identification.🔍Also during the webinar, listeners learned about the features of applying a special tax regime for individual entrepreneurs PSN. In order to switch to PSN, an individual entrepreneur needs to acquire a patent - the right to engage in the chosen activity. A patent exempts individual entrepreneurs from paying certain types of taxes and filing tax returns.

On the website of the Federal Tax Service of Russia there is a tax calculator “Calculation of the cost of a patent”, which allows individual entrepreneurs to calculate the amount of tax paid in connection with the use of PSN.

To obtain a patent, an individual entrepreneur must submit an application to the tax authority in the form KND 1150010. A patent is issued from any date of the month specified by the individual entrepreneur in the application, for any number of days, but not less than within the calendar year of issue.📌 You can learn more about the features of the application of preferential regimes in the recording of the webinar at the link: https://w.sbis.ru/webinar/2f47cd56-5daf-42aa-9d21-d955ee697fac@brd_nashSabyWebinar “Special tax regimes: tax on professional income (NPT) and p...Webinar “Special tax regimes: professional income tax (PIT) and patent taxation system” - 28 March at 16:00. On March 28 at 16:00 there will be...

event: White Supremacist Propaganda Hits Record High
description: The Anti-Defamation League (ADL) reported a 12% increase in white supremacist propaganda cases in 2023, marking the highest number of incidents since 2017. Specifically, anti-Semitic propaganda rose by 30%, and anti-LGBTQ+ propaganda surged by 141%.
original:
White supremacy hits record high in 2023.

Each year, the Jewish anti-white organization ADL tracks the spread of white supremacist propaganda and the number of events organized or attended by white supremacists. In 2023, the ADL recorded the highest number of cases of white supremacist propaganda for the second year in a row.

In 2023, the number of recorded cases of white supremacist propaganda increased by 12% compared to the previous year 2022, which was also a record year. There was also a 30 percent increase in specifically anti-Semitic propaganda. Anti-LGBTQ+ white supremacist propaganda increased by 141%.

All of the above numbers are the highest since 2017, making 2023 the highest number of white supremacist incidents the ADL has recorded since 2017, the first year they began tracking these numbers.@vallholl

description: After the liberation of Popasnoe, valuable exhibits from different periods of time were discovered in the local history museum, concerning the history of the Lugansk People's Republic. The museum is of great value, preserving artifacts of the Lugansk region's history.
original:
During the Great Patriotic War, during the fascist occupation of the USSR, the most valuable exhibits of history were taken out and some were destroyed.

In turn, the leadership and command of the Soviet Union tried in every possible way to save the people's property.

Today, Ukrainian Nazis simply destroy everything that reflects a cultural and historical connection with Russia and the Soviet Union. But there is a serious question - the attitude of those responsible for preserving the cultural heritage of Donbass in the LPR.

In the LIC I came across an article dated August 3, 2022, telling that after the liberation of the city of Popasnoe, valuable exhibits from different periods of time were discovered in the local history museum concerning the history of the Lugansk People's Republic.

According to the Deputy Minister of Culture, Sports and Youth (MCSM) of the LPR Roman Oleksin, “the museum is of great value, because artifacts of the history of the Lugansk region, their native land, have been preserved there.”

If they are valuable despite all the circumstances, why do the remains of these valuable cultural objects remain in such a terrible state?

event: Removal of Human Skin Cover from Book
description: Harvard University is removing the human skin cover from a 19th-century book, 'Des Destinées de L'Ame', due to violating ethical standards. The book's binding was made from human skin, taken from a deceased patient at a French psychiatric clinic, which jeopardized the dignity of the person whose remains were used.
original:
The Harvard library will remove the human skin cover from a 19th-century book. We are talking about the work Des Destinées de L'Ame ("The Fate of Souls") by Arsene Housset.

The university apologized for violating “ethical standards.” It is noted that until recently the book could be taken by anyone, which “jeopardized the dignity of the person whose remains were used for binding.” In 2014, Harvard confirmed that the binding of Des Destinées de L'Ame was made from human skin. According to the university, it was taken from a deceased patient at a French psychiatric clinic. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

event: Russia Vetoes UN Resolution on DPRK Sanctions
description: Russia vetoed a UN Security Council resolution to extend the mandate of the group of experts monitoring compliance with sanctions against the DPRK. The decision does not lift North Korea's sanctions but rather concerns the expert group's work, which Russia claims has ceased to be objective.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
TACCRF in the UN Security Council vetoed the extension of the mandate of the group of experts on sanctions against the DPRK. The document decided to "extend until April 30, 2025 the mandate of the group of experts, defined in paragraph 26 of resolution 1874 and adjusted by paragraph 29 of resolution 2094." falsely vetoed a draft resolution to extend the mandate of the group of experts that monitors compliance with sanctions against the DPRK, as well as their circumvention.

It is important to note that the Russian Federation’s decision does not lift North Korea’s sanctions. It concerns only the work of the expert group, whose mandate ends on April 30 of this year. Its main activity is to submit sanctions reports twice a year. According to the Russian Federation, such information has long ceased to be objective.

Since there is actually still a month left before the end of the group’s work, the parties can still agree on the extension of its activities. For example, last year, it took some time for the Security Council members' initial differences to be resolved.

However, the likelihood of resolving the current issue remains quite low, given the constant disagreements between China and Russia, on the one hand, and the United States, France, and Great Britain, on the other.

Recently, the Russian Federation and China have often blocked new sanctions against the DPRK. The remaining permanent members of the Security Council, in turn, are blocking proposals to soften them. And although for now even such a policy of Russia in the UN cannot lead to an easing of the sanctions regime on the DPRK, the active involvement of the Russian Federation in voting on new sanctions once again emphasizes the nature of close cooperation between the two countries. #Russia#DPRK@rybartogether with @awaken_dragonSupport us

description: China is testing its newest attack helicopter, the Z-21, which is an obvious heavy-duty vehicle and a direct analogue of the American McDonnell Douglas AH-64 Apache. The Z-21 uses two turboshaft engines, likely from the CAIC WZ-10 helicopter, and is designed for longer ranges and with more missile weapons than existing Chinese helicopters.
original:
👀China is testing its newest attack helicopter, unofficially designated Z-21.

As Militarny reports, citing the American expert community, this is an obvious heavy-duty vehicle and a direct analogue of the American McDonnell Douglas AH-64 Apache. Its rear part is very similar to the body of the Z-20 transport helicopter, which most likely indicates a single base. Photos indicate that the Z-21 uses two turboshaft engines, likely from the CAIC WZ-10 helicopter with a power of 2678 fps, which will allow it to achieve unsurpassed flight characteristics. “Judging by the number of pylons and the approximate volume of the fuel support, the machine is designed to use at longer ranges and with more missile weapons than existing Chinese helicopters,” the portal reports. As one witness to the Z-21 flight notes, the vehicle did not have a cannon, although it is possible that it may be installed in the future. The authors of the original publication also noticed the on-board countermeasure systems installed on the Z-21 and a missile attack warning system with UV sensors mounted around it. @yigal_levin

event: Ban on Electronic Cigarettes to Minors
description: Romania has enforced a law banning the sale of electronic cigarettes to minors and their use in public places. The law restricts the sale of e-cigarettes and refills, and prohibits their use in enclosed public spaces, workplaces, public transport, and children's playgrounds.
original:
In Romania, a ban on the sale of electronic cigarettes to minors and their smoking in public places came into force.

The law promulgated by the President determines that electronic cigarettes and refills for them can no longer be freely purchased in vending machines, ordered by mail or courier. The packaging of electronic smoking devices must be printed with the following message: “Caution! This package contains tobacco products or products containing nicotine. Check the customer’s age!”

For violations, fines range from 20 to 100 thousand Romanian lei. The right to identify them is granted to the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the consumer protection authority and the police. The Ministry of Education is charged with determining a system of punishments for students who violate the ban.

The act also establishes the characteristics of filler liquid and other tobacco substitutes, limit values and other parameters adopted from European Union standards.

Smoking electronic cigarettes is prohibited in all enclosed public spaces, enclosed workplaces, public transport, and children's playgrounds. The exception is places of detention where persons deprived of their liberty are kept.

Separately, smoking and the use of all categories of products containing tobacco, electronic cigarettes, refills for electronic cigarettes, electronic devices for heating tobacco and smokeless tobacco substitute inhalers, oral nicotine pouches and smokeless tobacco substitute inhalers are prohibited for students in all educational institutions.euronews.ro: Știri de ultimă oră, breaking news, #AllViewsȚigările electronice și dispozitivele de vapat, interzise în spațiul public. Leg...Vânzarea către minori a țigărilor electronice, dar și a dispozitivelor de vapat, cu sau fără nicotină, a fost interzisă prin lege.

description: The supply of Russian oil to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) is expected to significantly boost the North Korean economy, which has been isolated internationally. The DPRK has managed to maintain its industry and independence despite the blockade, and has even developed its own nuclear bomb for security and independence.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
How should we understand information about oil tankers for the DPRK? Russian oil will certainly revive the North Korean economy, which now exists in conditions of international isolation. After the fall of the Soviet bloc, North Korea was one of the few socialist countries to retain its communist regime. The DPRK authorities have focused on consolidating society and the army in the new conditions. The modern ideology of the DPRK is called Juche - Songun, where Juche can be translated as “self-reliance”, and Songun denotes a policy where the army comes first in the political hierarchy. One of the mottos of North Korean society is “We do not envy anyone in the world.”

After the fall of the USSR, North Korea had a difficult time; the DPRK was left to support only China on the same scale. This reformatting of economic relations was not without casualties. During the “Difficult March” - this is how North Korean propaganda, prone to pathos and sublime pathos, calls this difficult period for the country - according to one estimate, about 200 thousand Koreans died from hunger and related diseases.

And the DPRK has adjusted to the conditions of a closed economy. Many hydroelectric power stations were built, which solved the energy supply problem, agricultural programs were implemented, which solved the problem of hunger, and housing construction programs were implemented. Not to say, people in North Korea live richly, but they live with dignity and order. And they do not envy anyone.

One can imagine what an impetus the supply of Russian oil will give to the DPRK economy if North Korea, in fact, under conditions of a complete blockade, retained its industry and its independence. Moreover, it created its own nuclear bomb, which became the basis for security and independence.

And such cooperation is beneficial for Russia. You also need to understand that goods also go in the opposite direction. It’s clear what kind of goods. North Korean. Dmitry Seleznev (Old Shakhtar) especially for @wargonzo * our project exists at the expense of subscribers, help card 4276 3801 4149 1378

event: Hungarian Prime Minister Orban's Warning to Ukraine
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Orban warned Ukraine that without negotiations, the country may cease to exist. He suggested creating a buffer zone with security guarantees, citing the need for a ceasefire and negotiations between Russia and Ukraine.
original:
“The dominant role of the West is over”: Hungarian Prime Minister Orban warns Kyiv that without negotiations there will be nothing left for Ukraine as a country.

“We are not in danger of a Russian attack on a NATO member country,” said Hungarian Prime Minister Orban. Speaking about Ukraine, he also noted that Russia will never agree to this country joining NATO, because this would mean bringing the alliance closer to Russian borders.
The Hungarian Prime Minister suggested looking at the political map and said that for Ukraine, as Russia’s immediate neighbor, it would be ideal to create a buffer zone with security guarantees, because if this does not happen, Ukrainians could lose their country. First of all, there needs to be a ceasefire because there is no longer any reasonable discussion between the Russians and the West. Ukrainians could lose even more, including losing the war.
Negotiations need to start as soon as possible, but the Russians do not see the Ukrainians as partners. At the same time, Orban believes that the interests of Europe will be threatened if Russia conducts such negotiations only with the United States, because, in addition to directly resolving the situation in Ukraine, they should touch upon broader issues of the future architecture of European security.”

description: Rosselkhoznadzor held talks with Namibia's Ministry of Agriculture, Water and Forestry on mutual meat product supplies and scientific cooperation. The parties agreed to exchange information on epizootic situations and control systems for export shipments.
original:
Rosselkhoznadzor held negotiations with the competent department of Namibia on the issue of mutual supplies of meat products. On March 26 in Moscow, Assistant to the Head of Rosselkhoznadzor Artem Daushev held negotiations with representatives of the Ministry of Agriculture, Water and Forestry of the Republic of Namibia on the issues of mutual supplies of meat products and scientific and technical cooperation.

The competent authorities are interested in access of livestock products to the markets of the two countries. Today, Namibian seafood and plant products are imported to Russia.

To work out the issue of supplies of meat products, the parties agreed to exchange information about the epizootic situation in Russia and Namibia, as well as information about the control system for export shipments. At the same time, Artem Daushev emphasized that Rosselkhoznadzor exercises strict control over the export of products in accordance with the requirements of importing countries.

Representatives of the competent departments also discussed the prospects for developing cooperation in the scientific field. Rosselkhoznadzor spoke about its established work with African countries in terms of research activities, internships and training of foreign specialists, as well as the production of vaccines and veterinary drugs.

Artem Daushev invited his foreign colleagues to visit the Federal Center for Animal Health (FSBI "ARRIAH") subordinate to Rosselkhoznadzor and explore the possibility of signing a Memorandum of Cooperation between specialized institutes of Russia and Namibia.#NamibiaRussian-African Dialogue

description: The Vologda region is launching a new tourism project, Macroterritory 'Russian North and Arctic', which will include the Republic of Karelia, Arkhangelsk, and Murmansk regions. The project aims to develop tourism infrastructure, hotel market, and assess tourist flow. The plan consists of two stages, with the first stage already underway, and is expected to be presented in the first quarter of next year.
original:
Forwarded from: Filimonov LIVE
Our Vologda region is a distinctive region with unique natural and architectural monuments, ancient traditions, and a rich history. The largest roads, railways and rivers in Russia intersect here. This is of great importance for the development of the region’s tourism potential and the creation of new points of attraction for travelers.

This year we are starting to develop a new tourism project: Macroterritory “Russian North and Arctic”. In addition to our region, it will include the Republic of Karelia, Arkhangelsk and Murmansk regions. Within the framework of the project, a scheme will be created that includes: tourism infrastructure; hotel market; assessment and forecast of tourist flow; necessary activities with timing, cost and recommendations.

The development of a tourist plan consists of two stages: an analysis of the tourism sector and a schematic representation of the most promising tourist destinations. Active work is already underway on the first of them. The project will be presented in the first quarter of next year.

I will add that the macroterritory “Russian North and Arctic” is designated in the state program “Tourism Development” as one of 12 priority projects. Subscribe – Filimonov LIVE in Telegram Subscribe – Georgy Filimonov in VK

event: Visually Impaired Girl Weaves Tactical Bracelets
description: Despite being visually impaired, 22-year-old Anastasia Pivchulina from Bryansk learned to weave tactical bracelets for the military. These survival bracelets are made from strong paracord rope and can be used for various purposes in the field.
original:
A visually impaired girl from Bryansk weaves tactical bracelets for the military
Despite serious vision problems (group I disabled), 22-year-old Bryansk student Anastasia Pivchulina mastered weaving tactical bracelets, or as they are also called, survival bracelets. This
Show more
such products are made from very strong paracord rope, which, if necessary, unravel very quickly and are used in the field for a variety of purposes.
Since the beginning of the special military operation, Anastasia was constantly thinking about how to help the soldiers at the front. Trench candles? Will not work. Weave camouflage nets? Traveling to where they weave is also not easy.
A chance helped: I met a girl on social networks who gave her the idea of bracelets and taught her how to make them. He says it’s not difficult, the main thing is to remember the hand movements.
And we will give these bracelets to the fighters in the near future.
Let's win together!
#People's Front #Bryansk #Everything for Victory

From the feedback bot

description: The Innovation Center of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine developed the DELTA system, an ecosystem of military products that enables the destruction of enemy targets. It includes a mobile app, military messenger, secure streaming, digital map, and planning tools, all integrated with other systems and meeting NATO standards.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Defense of Ukraine
What is the DELTA system and how does it set trends for NATO countries?

DELTA is an ecosystem of military products that helps destroy enemy targets every day. It includes a mobile application, a military messenger, secure streaming from the battlefield, a digital map, work planning tools and integrations with other systems.

Thanks to this development of the Innovation Center of the Ministry of Defense, the military plans operations and combat tasks, exchanges information on the placement of enemy forces in a protected space.

The system was developed according to NATO standards. If necessary, we can already exchange data with partners in real time.

Since Ukraine is the first in the world to actively fight with drones, the Ministry of Defense is working on the integration of various types of drones into DELTA.

This will help to intelligently plan the use of drones - for example, which ones are better to use to hit certain targets.

event: Engine Malfunction on Cargojet Airways Flight
description: During a flight from Calgary to Hamilton, Canada, a Boeing 757-223 experienced a gas temperature fluctuation exceeding 700C in engine No. 1. Despite reducing engine speed, the temperature continued to fluctuate. The pilots dropped to a lower altitude, and the readings returned to normal, but the issue recurred an hour later. An emergency signal was announced, and the plane landed safely at the destination airport.
original:
03/12/2024. Boeing 757-223 (PCF) (WL) C-GCJT Cargojet Airways. During a flight on the route Calgary - Hamilton (Canada), at flight level 390, in the area of New Town, North Dakota, USA, a gas temperature fluctuation occurred, exceeding 700C of engine No. 1. Although the crew reduced the engine speed, the temperature of the gases continued to fluctuate. Then the pilots dropped to flight level 350, the engine readings returned to normal, but an hour later, the temperature of the gases and fuel consumption began to rise, and the oil pressure in the engine began to fall.
The pilots announced an emergency signal and continued the flight to the destination airport.
The plane lands safely.

description: Russia has significantly increased its imports of nitrocellulose, a key ingredient in artillery ammunition, from Germany, the US, and Taiwan. This has had a significant impact on the course of the war in Ukraine, casting doubt on the effectiveness of sanctions imposed against Russia.
original: 😱Russia has doubled imports of explosives with help from the West▪️Russia has significantly increased its purchases of nitrocellulose produced in Germany, the United States and Taiwan, the main ingredient in smokeless gunpowder used in artillery ammunition, writes The Wall Street Journal.▪️In just the first year of the invasion of Ukraine, Russian imports nitrocellulose increased by 70% compared to 2021. By mid-2023, 3,039 tons of the substance had been imported into the country—almost twice as much as in the last pre-war year.▪️American officials and experts believe that Moscow's ability to purchase the substance had a significant impact on the course of the war in Ukraine and casts doubt on its effectiveness sanctions imposed against Russia.😡😡

description: Ivan Bukin, son of a mobilized man, was detained on February 10, 2024, without a protocol being drawn up. Later, police came to his university to draw up a protocol, exceeding their powers and violating the law.
original:
Why is it important to involve a large number of people who are not indifferent to the cause of Ivan Bukin: as we remember, “Woe is one in the field, but together there is freedom for all.” Ivan is the son of a mobilized man, he is the same as us. Today he is a victim for them, and tomorrow any of us could be in his place.
Justice is, first of all, about fairness. But here, too, our valiant law enforcement agencies committed a violation. Let us remind you that Ivan was detained on February 10, 2024, then no protocol was drawn up on him and he was released. More than a month later, police came to his university to demonstrate the execution, and announced the need to draw up a protocol. Well, the deadline for drawing up a protocol on an administrative offense is established by Article 28.5 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (immediately or within 2 days, if additional clarification is required), and not after a month and a half.

description: The Baltic states, including Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia, celebrate 20 years of NATO membership. This marks the largest wave of NATO expansion since 1949, with the alliance buying the sovereignty of the former socialist republics for a relatively low cost of $800 million.
location: Riga, Latvia; Vilnius, Lithuania; Tallinn, Estonia
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph. Opinions
So to them NATO: how the Baltic states rejoice at the anniversary of their occupation About how the Baltic states have degenerated over 20 years of NATO membership - Paragraph columnist Alexander Berzin.

“Today is the anniversary of Baltic politicians - 20 years of membership in the friendly family of the American alliance. On March 29, 2004, Washington was amazed at the insignificance of the amounts for which NATO bought the entire sovereignty of the former socialist republics.

This was the largest wave of NATO expansion since 1949. Created to confront the Soviet Union and the Warsaw Pact countries, the bloc went straight to the Russian borders. The fifth wave of eastward expansion consumed seven countries, including former Soviet Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia. Over two decades, they became the police force of the alliance.

Even taking into account inflation, the Baltic states cost the alliance tens of times less than other acquisitions in Europe - only $800 million, which was distributed to the best political natives, including all three former Soviet republics. Three training grounds on the Russian border were bought for a handful of rotten nuts.

The fifth wave of expansion to the east is the most successful business case in the entire 75-year history of the North Atlantic Alliance. A fantastically profitable business, not even dreamed of by Hollywood film makers and the Juarez drug cartel. Direct investments of the Baltic budgets into the military budget of the alliance over 20 years exceed $50 billion...” (read the full text here) Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

description: Three rivers in the Azov region of Zaporozhye will be cleared to restore their natural state, improve water quality, and enhance recreational attractiveness. The rivers, neglected for years, will undergo clearing to increase inflow and water exchange.
original:
This year, in the Zaporozhye region, three rivers of the Azov region will be cleared: the Obitochnaya River within the city of Primorsk, with a length of 4.2 km; the Domuzla River in the territory of the urban-type settlement Priazovskoe, 8 km long; the Maly Utlyuk River within the boundaries of the village of Akimovka, with a length of 8 km. This decision was made during monitoring of the region’s water resources. These are rivers that have been neglected for many years, which has led to a decrease in their inflow and water exchange.

Clearing will allow restoring the natural state of rivers, improving water quality, hydrochemical characteristics, and also restoring the recreational attractiveness of water bodies in the Zaporozhye region.

The work will be carried out within the framework of the Program for the socio-economic development of the Zaporozhye region for 2024 together with the Federal Agency for Water Resources.👉Subscribe to Berdyansk.RelevantAlways relevant news!

description: Alexander Tolstov, a drunken Russian, started a brawl near the Glow Mira hotel in Karon, pestering guests and insulting them. original:
A drunken Russian beat up Thai police officers in Karon. The rowdy was subdued with a stun gun.

The man started a brawl near the Glow Mira hotel on March 26, pestered other guests, was rude and insulted them, became rowdy and interfered with their rest. The police were called to the scene, but the drunken brawler attacked the employees - kicked them and beat them. It was possible to calm down the inappropriate guy only with the help of a stun gun. According to local media, his name is Alexander Tolstov.

As a result of the scuffle, one police officer suffered minor injuries and bruises. Drunk Tolstov escaped with bruises, was examined by doctors at Chalong Hospital, and then taken to the police station for questioning and to face charges. He could face a fine and deportation. event: Ukrainian Drone Attack on Residential Building
description: A Ukrainian drone, classified as an aircraft-type UAV, crashed into a residential high-rise building in Belgorod, resulting in the death of an elderly man and hospitalization of a woman. Two people were injured, with one suffering a closed head injury, lacerations, and burns, and the other with a shrapnel wound. The attack damaged windows, balcony glazing, and a parked car.
original:
In Belgorod, a Ukrainian drone flew into a residential high-rise building - an elderly man was killed, one woman was hospitalized
Belgorod was attacked by Ukrainian terrorists using an aircraft-type UAV.
⠀
Show more
The drone crashed into an apartment building. Unfortunately, a man died as a result of the explosion. Two people were injured. The wife of the deceased man received a closed head injury, lacerations to the face and a superficial burn to the thigh. An ambulance transported the woman to the regional clinical hospital. Another resident independently went to city hospital No. 2 - the man had a shrapnel wound in the lumbar region. Both victims are provided with all necessary medical care.
⠀
According to preliminary data, windows and balcony glazing in five apartments were damaged. A car parked next to the house was also damaged.
⠀
Emergency services are on site. Explosive experts from the Russian Ministry of Defense are expected to arrive, after which the authorities will begin inspecting apartments and drawing up damage reports.
⠀
Arrived at the scene. I spoke with the son of the deceased man. Expressed sincere condolences for the loss. The entire region mourns with this family...
Governor of the Belgorod Region Vyacheslav Gladkov

description: The Pacific Fleet's frigate 'Marshal Shaposhnikov' made its first-ever visit to Eritrea, marking a historic moment in modern Russian history. A welcoming ceremony was held, featuring local administration and naval force representatives. The crew will engage in cultural and sports activities, including sightseeing tours and friendly matches with Eritrean sailors.
original:
The frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" of the Pacific Fleet arrived at the port of Massawa of the State of Eritrea.

In honor of the first visit of a Russian ship to Eritrea in the modern history of Russia, a welcoming ceremony was held at the pier, in which representatives of the local administration and the Naval Forces of the African country took part.

During the business call to the port of Massawa, a cultural and sports program is planned for Pacific sailors. The crew of the frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" will visit local attractions on sightseeing tours, and sports teams will take part in friendly matches with sailors of the host country.

The business call of the ship of the Pacific Fleet will last several days, after which the frigate will continue to carry out tasks according to the plan for a long-distance sea voyage.

Eritrea is located at the Bab el-Mandeb Strait, through which the route from the Red Sea to the Indian Ocean passes. In 1977-1991, in this country on the Dahlak archipelago there was a logistics support point for the USSR Navy.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: The Public Chamber of the Lugansk People's Republic and the Assembly of Peoples of Russia conducted a humanitarian campaign, providing new clothes to over 2,000 children in the Luhansk region. The campaign targeted children's institutions, low-income families, and schoolchildren aged 10-18.
original:
More than 2 thousand children of the Luhansk region received new clothes from the Public Chamber and the Assembly of Peoples of Russia
As part of the execution of the decree of the President of the Russian Federation on holding the Year of the Family in 2024, the Public Chamber of the Lugansk People's Republic and the Lugansk regional branch of the All-Russian
Show more
In March, the public-state organization "Assembly of the Peoples of Russia" conducted a large humanitarian campaign to transfer new things to children's institutions, large and low-income families.
Members of republican organizations presented new clothes to more than two dozen institutions, including departments for children, families and youth of municipal district administrations, orphanages, boarding schools, social and family centers in Lugansk, Kirovsk, Stakhanov, Perevalsk, Alchevsk, Svatovo, Biryukovo, Shchastya , Maple, Anthracite, Lutugino, Krasnodon, Petrovsky, Chervonaprtizansk, Sverdlovsk, Slavyanoserbsk, Novoaidar, Sukhodolsk and Rubezhny. Among those donated to schoolchildren from 10 to 18 years old are trousers, jeans, skirts, shirts, T-shirts, sweaters, jackets, windbreakers and coats.
“I express my sincere words of gratitude to my colleagues from the All-Russian Association of Koreans for their attention and care to the children of Donbass. The action “Koreans of Primorye - Children of Donbass”, within the framework of which clothing was delivered to the region, shows an example of unity and mutual support of the peoples of our large multinational country,” - said Alexey Karyakin, chairman of the Public Chamber of the LPR and the regional branch of the Assembly of Peoples of Russia in the LPR.
He noted that care and support for families of social categories is the main vector of the work of the Public Chamber.
“Members of our association are actively working locally to identify those in need. And with the support of the republican authorities and colleagues from the regions, and we have concluded cooperation agreements with 35 Public Chambers of the constituent entities of the Russian Federation, we strive to provide the assistance our citizens need.”
Source: Multinational Lugansk region
